Elena is 36 years old and lives with her husband and her 3 children in her own house. For 20 years she has been dedicated to embroidery. She works in the comfort of her own home. This type of work requires much concentration to combine the colors and realize exact stitches that define a good design and the durability of the embroidery. For the business, she can count on the help of some family members and a neighbor, with whom she shares the earnings. For the future, Elena wishes to produce her embroidery in larger quantities in order to have more customers. This is her sixth opportunity for a loan with MFP. Moreover, she is very content to be part of a communal bank because it provides a space for friendship and learning. The money which she is soliciting will be utilized to buy materials necessary for embroidery, such as thread, cloth and needles.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY MATERIALS FOR EMBROIDERY

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en la casa de sus padres.
Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de cigarros (al por mayor), los cuales reparte en las tiendas de las diferentes ciudades de su localidad. Diariamente se abastece de mercadería de una distribuidora muy grande en su región, de esa manera logra vender  su producto a un menor precio. 
Debido a la puntualidad de entrega tiene varios clientes estables, siendo su esposo quien se encarga de distribuir la mercadería y Leticia de administrar las ganancias.
Para el futuro, desea crecer hasta lograr ser una de las más grandes distribuidoras de su localidad.

Esta es la séptima oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, y lo que más aprecia de su banco comunal es que aprendió el valor del ahorro y el trabajo en equipo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra más de cajas de cigarro para incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Leticia, 32, lives with her husband and their son in her parents’ house. She has been selling cigarettes (wholesale) for five years. She distributes them to stores in the different cities of her area. Everyday she stocks up on merchandise from a very large distributor in her region. This way she is able to sell her product at a lower price. She has several regular customers because of the punctuality of delivery. Her husband is in charge of distributing the merchandise, and Leticia administers the earnings. In the future she hopes to grow until she is one of the biggest distributors in her area. This is her seventh opportunity of having a loan with MFP. What she appreciates the most about her communal bank is that she learned the value of savings and working as a team. She will use the money she is now asking for to buy more cases of cigarettes to increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 21 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 5 años en su casa propia.
Desde hace más de 7 años se dedica a la venta de quesos (al por mayor). De preferencia, vende los días jueves de cada semana, ya los otros días viaja hasta su pueblo para abastecerse de la mercadería que necesita.
Maritza reparte sus quesos a los comerciantes de los puestos de ventas en el mercado central de su ciudad y debido a la calidad de su producto tiene una buena cantidad de clientes que aseguran sus ganancias mensuales.
Por tal motivo, en adelante, quiere extender su sus ventas a los puestos de otros mercados de su zona.

Esta es la cuarta oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una socia muy activa y participativa de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de más quesos y baldes, que le sirven para transportar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Maritza, 21, lives with her husband and their five year old son in their own house. For over seven years she has been selling cheese (wholesale). By choice, she sells on Thursdays every week. The other days she travels to her town to stock up on the merchandise that she needs. Maritza delivers her cheese to the merchants who have stalls in the central market of her city. Due to the quality of her product, she has a good quantity of customers, which assures her monthly earnings. For that reason, going forward, she wants to extend her sales to stalls in other markets in the region. This is her fourth opportunity to have a loan with MFP. She is a very active and participatory member of her communal bank. She will use the money she is now asking for to buy more cheese and buckets, which will be used to transport her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda, tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos en su casa propia.
DesD. hace 6 años se dedica la venta D. granos y queso D. manera ambulante. Los días cuando mayores ganancias obtiene es cuando hay ferias en su zona. Por ello, se abastece  cada 15 días, para que su negocio siga siempre activo. Yolanda está muy contenta con este negocio porque le permite solventar los gastos D. su familia. 
Para más adelante, desD. tener un puesto estable donD. pueda vender mayor cantidad D. quesos y otros productos comestibles, logrando crecer hasta ser una distribuidora alimentos al por mayor.

Esta es la séptima vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y está muy contenta D. pertenecer a un banco comunal, ya que con el apoyo D. sus compañeros ha superado varias dificultades económicas.
En esta ocasión, el dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. mercadería en granos, como menestras y cereales.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 50 years old and lives with her husband and 6 children in the family's own house. For the past 6 years, Yolanda has been selling bulk dry foods and cheese as a mobile vendor. She obtains her highest profits on days when there are markets in her area. Because of this, she stocks up on supplies every 15 days, so that her business will always be active. Yolanda is very happy with this business, because it lets her ensure that her family's expenses are covered. For the future, she wants to have a permanent sales stand where she can sell a larger quantity of cheeses and other food products, and eventually expand her business into a wholesale food distributor. This is Yolanda's seventh loan with MFP, and she is very happy to belong to a communal bank, since with the support of her fellow members, she has been able to overcome a number of economic difficulties. On this occasion, the funds she is requesting will be invested in purchasing bulk dry foods such as beans and grains.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her inventory

loans.name: Ivania Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Ivania tiene un negocio de líneas de ropa la cual distribuye en vario lugares del sector ella tiene dos trabajadores que le colocan la mercadería y a la vez cobran las cuentas pendientes por pagar, el negocio tiene cuatro años de existir pero ella esta encargada desde ya mas de un año ya que antes solamente estudiaba y el negocio lo miraba el papa pero por problemas de salud ella esta a cargo de la administración del mismo. 
El crédito lo ocupara para invertirlo en la compra de mas productos ya que así aumentara su capital de trabajo y a si podrá tener mayores ingresos, ella es soltera y esta estudiando en la universidad con el negocio costea sus estudio y le ayuda a sus padres en el sustento de la familia.
texts.en:
Ivania has a business selling lines of clothing which she distributes in various places in her sector. She has two workers who place the merchandise and collect pending account payments. The business has existed for 4 years but she has been in charge for over a year. Before, she just studied and her father looked after the business. But due to problems with his health, she has taken charge of administering it. The loan will be used to purchase products that will increase working capital and thus, bring in more income. Ivania is single and is studying in the university. The business helps pay for her studies and helps her parents to sustain the family.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY MERCHANDISE: SHOES, PANTS, BLOUSES, COSMETICS, PERFUMES AND BACKPACKS

loans.name: Elbie

texts.en:
Elbie F. is from the village of Tinaclaan Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old. Elbie is single and has one infant child. To make a living, Elbie plants and harvests rice for sale. Elbie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Elbie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elbie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elbie is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the 19th loan taken out by Elbie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Jazmina De Lo Ángeles

texts.es: Jazmina de los Ángeles A. R. es una señora humilde y muy trabajadora. Ella se dedica desde muy joven al destace de cerdo actividad económica muy común en Nicaragua y gran demanda debido a que gran parte de la población desde el viernes esperan comerse un frito, morongas, patas de chancho en caldillo, nacatamal, cerdo adobado etc.
texts.en:
Jazmina de los Ángeles A. R. is a humble and very hardworking woman. From a young age, she has been involved with cutting up and selling pork. This is a very common business in Nicaragua due to the great demand from most of the population, who, on the weekends, want to eat fried pork, blood sausage, pork legs in gravy, tamales, marinated pork, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

texts.en:
Myrna T. is from the village of Dullan. She is 47 years old. Myrna is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Myrna is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna sells sand & gravel in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Myrna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Paula Elvira

texts.es: Paula Elvira P. es una señora muy trabajadora ella tiene un pequeño establecimiento de de venta y distribución de tropigas (gas butano de dicha marca). Este es el único puesto que existe en el barrio por lo cual tiene varios clientes. Pero además de esto ella se ayuda haciendo reposterías por encargo en cuyo negocio le va muy bien.

This is the only store in the neighborhood, so she has various clients. But in addition to this, she helps herself by making special-order pastries, and this business is going very well for her.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bulk grains, soap, meat, etc.

loans.name: Luz Y Amor Group

texts.es: El  grupo Luz y Amor está integrado por tres mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras ella son Yenny Vanessa G. P.   quien vende ropa y  cosméticos de la Avon, Silvia Rosa H. hace y vende frijoles cocidos y nacatamales los cuales son muy demandados debido a que en  la mesa del nicaragüense a cualquier tiempo no debe faltar los frijoles y los nacatamales especialmente los fines de semana y  Norma  Felicitas Espinoza  comercializa ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en:
The group "Luz y Amor" (Light and Love) is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial women. Yenny Vanessa G. P. sells clothing and Avon cosmetics. Silvia Rosa H. makes and sells cooked beans and pork tamales, which are very much in demand, because at no time should a Nicaraguan table be missing beans and pork tamales, especially on weekends. Norma Felicitas Espinoze sells clothing and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Luz Marina

Esta con el tiempo fue creciendo hasta convertirla en una pulpería la cual tiene bien surtida con todo lo necesario. Ella invertirá el préstamo para comprar mayor cantidad de producto y así suplir la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
In 1990 Luz Marina B. V. opened a small window where she offered essential products. With time, this small window became a general store well stocked with all sorts of necessities. She will invest the loan in buying a larger amount of products to meet her clients' demand.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Oasis De Amor Group

texts.es:
El grupo Oasis de Amor está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ella es Mercedes Amalia G. D. quien desde hace cinco años comercializa ropa.  Ella comenzó con poca mercadería con el tiempo fue creciendo su negocio y es por ello que requiere de una mayor inversión.

Su compañera Elena del Carmen F. P. empezó desde muy joven a  vender cosméticos primeramente entre sus compañeros, amigos y vecinos luego decidió comercializar ropa. En estos le fue muy bien y espera seguir creciendo. Mientras  Heidi Adriana F. D. vende ropa usada de manera ambulante ella se levanta muy temprano para salir a ofertar su producto y llega hasta muy tarde a su casa rendida por las largas camitas y el calor incesante.

Ellas ocuparan el prestamo para comprar mercaderia en sus respetivos negocios y seguir trabajando arduamente.
texts.en:
The group "Oasis de Amor" (Oasis of Love) is formed by three working women. One of htem is Mercedes Amalia Gutierrez D. who has been selling clothing for 5 years. She began with just a little merchandise and with time has been growing her business, and is requesting this loan for more working capital. Her companion in the group, Elena del Carmen F. P., began selling cosmetics when she was very young. She began selling them among her friends and neighbors and later decided to send clothing. The business has been going well and she hopes to keep growing. Heidi Adriana F. D. sells used clothing as a street vendor. She wakes up very early to sell her products and doesn't get home until very late, at which point she is very tired from all the walking and the intense heat. The group will be using the loan to buy merchandise for their businesses and to continue to work hard.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Julievi's Group

texts.en:
Julievi B. is from the village of Biray in Ozamiz City. She is 22 years old. Julievi is the leader of a 2-member loan group sponsored by GDMPC. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Julievi is single. To make a living, Julievi makes and sells snacks, such as "puto" rice cakes and banana cue (deep-fried bananas covered with caramelized brown sugar) in the local community. Julievi has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Julievi joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julievi is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase the ingredients that she needs to make products to sell. This will be Julievi's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia J. is from the village of Owaon. She is 25 years old. Sylvia is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Sylvia sells cosmetics in the local community. Sylvia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Sylvia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sylvia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. Sylvia is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP to buy a second-hand motorcycle that her husband will use to transport passengers. This will be Sylvia's 8th loan from PMPC and her second from Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions and to support the education of her children.

Shown in the photo is the passenger side-car that will be attached to the motorcyle that she will be purchasing.  The motorized passenger sidecar is the most common public transport vehicle in the village. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorcycle to transport passengers

loans.name: Carmen's Group

texts.en:
Carmen M. is from the village of Santa Cruz in Tangub City. She is 55 years old. Carmen is the leader of a 5-member loan group sponsored by GDMPC. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Carmen is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Carmen runs a general store where she sells a variety of different products, such as shampoo, sugar, salt, noodles, juice packs, Milo (chocolate milk powder), and eggs, in the local community. Carmen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP each month from these activities.

In 2010, Carmen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmen is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Carmen's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ursula

texts.en:
Ursula O. is from the village of Owaon. She is 60 years old. Ursula is married and has 9 adult children. To make a living, Ursula plants, harvest, and sells a variety of vegetables. Ursula has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,700 PHP average a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ursula joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ursula has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Ursula is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, fertilizer, and young crops to raise. This will be Ursula's third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, fertilizer, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Claire's Group

texts.en:
Claire R. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 18 years old, single, and the leader of a six-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
To make a living, Claire owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling dried fish in the local community. Claire has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Claire joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Claire is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita E. is from the village of Galas. She is 50 years old, is married, and has one adult child. Anita owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling steamed rice cake products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Anita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Anita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC and her second from Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions of her family and to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Epefania

texts.en: Epefania T. is from the village of Langatian. She is 50 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Epefania owns and operates a business running a food stall, selling variety of fruits in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Epefania joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Epefania is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her third from PMPC and her second from Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Maria Chuchi

texts.en:
Maria Chuchi T. is from the village of Antipolo. She is 36 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children.

Maria Chuchi owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns an average of approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Maria Chuchi joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

Maria Chuchi is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her ninth from PMPC and her second from Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions of her family and to support the education of her children.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizer

loans.name: Irina

texts.en: Irina is single. For the past four years, she has been selling various types of insurance. Her client base has been growing, bringing Irina a stable income. She would now like to borrow 12,000 UAH to improve her business. She would like to make repairs and improvements to her office, and hopes this will attract even more new clients.

loans.use: To make repairs and improvements to her office

loans.name: Andriy

texts.en: Andriy is 21 years old and single. He sells bags and some clothing at a small store that he rents. Andrei started this business two years ago with the help of his mother, who has been in a similar business for many years. Andrei enjoys learning about sales and making progress with his business. He would like to develop it further and increase the variety of his stock. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 UAH, and hopes to invest the additional income he makes back into his business.

loans.use: To increase the variety of his stock

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: S. Sam is 35 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. He is a businessman who owns a shop selling insecticides, pesticides, and so on. He has been in this business for over three years. Sam is using his loan to purchase and stock a variety of insecticides and pesticides for sale. He wishes to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase insecticides and pesticides to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: S. Ali is 37 years old, married, and has six children. For over five years, he has owned a retail shop. He is using his loan to purchase retail items such as soap, flour, rice, bread, sugar, drinks, and so forth for sale. He is a very hardworking businessman whose dream is to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as soap, flour, rice, bread, sugar and drinks

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr: Binta B. est âgée de 30, elle est célibataire sans enfant mais a la charge d'un enfant de ses parents. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WALIDANE depuis 5 ans et y a bénéficié de 10 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés. Elle fait de la broderie et la confection de draps de lit. Son objectif est de pouvoir faire face à tous ses besoins et d'assurer une bonne couverture sanitaire et scolaire de l'enfant qu'on lui a confié.
texts.en:
Binta B. is 30 years old, she is single and has no children, although she is taking care of one child for his parents. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Walidane for the past 5 years and has been the beneficiary of 10 loans in the past, all of which she properly managed and repaid. Binta B. makes embroidered items and bedsheets. Her goal is to be able to care for all of her needs and assure the good health and education of the child entrusted in her care.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To reinforce her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase lubricants for motors

loans.name: Basilio

texts.es:
El Sr. Bacilio tiene 20 años de edad nació y creció en la comunidad de Pakai Municipio de El Torno Santa Cruz.

El Sr. Basilio es soltero, muy trabajador y responsable desea muy pronto formar una familia tener hijos   

Su actividad principal es la agricultura cuenta con su propias tierras que son de su propiedad  el trabaja ya 5 años independiente de sus padres el la agricultura, el siembra maíz, yuca y poroto, para luego comercializar sus productos en el mercado de su comunidad

El señor esta agradecido con la institución por brindarle su apoyo.
texts.en:
Bacilio is 20 years old. He was born in and grew up in the community of Pakai Municipio de El Torno Santa Cruz. He is single, very hardworking and responsible. He wishes to have a family with children soon. His main business activity is agriculture. He has his own lands, which are his property. He has worked independently from his parents for five years already. He plants corn, yucca, and beans. He then sells his produce in the community market. He is grateful for the institution for supporting him.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raise capital for work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a stock of drinks and food products for his store

loans.name: Alvaro Willmark

texts.es:
El Sr. Alvaro tiene como actividad el servicio de seguridad integral ""Proteg""  empresa  que brinda seguridad a instituciones que asi lo requieran (seguridad  privada), incluyendo Emprender en sus agencias de la ciudad de La Paz, es un negocio familiar ya esta actividad la desarrolla conjuntamente con su hermano, constituyendose  en la principal fuente de ingreso para el y toda su familia, que esta compuesta por sus padres, hermano y su pequeño hijo.

El destino del credito sera principalmente para capital de trabajo, compra de uniformes de trabajo para sus empleados.
texts.en:
Alvaro’s business is providing comprehensive security. His company, Proteg, offers security (private security) to institutions that need it. This includes Emprender as one of their agencies in the city of La Paz. This is a family business because he develops it together with his brother. It is the primary source of income for him and his whole family, which is comprised of his parents, his brother, and his small child. The loan will be primarily for working capital to buy work uniforms for his employees.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy work uniforms

loans.name: Penda

texts.fr: Penda D. est mariée, elle âgée de 54 ans et a 8 enfants en charge. Elle a une bonne expérience avec le crédit pour en avoir bénéficié 9 fois de suite. Son objectif est de poursuivre son activité de restauration afin de se procurer des bénéfices qui lui permettrons de participer au bien-être familiale.
texts.en:
Penda D. is married, 54 years old and has 8 children she cares for. She has a good experience with loans for having been granted 9 of them. Her goal is to continue her food-serving business and make profits that will allow her to participate in the family welfare.

Translated from French by Caroline Mrejen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Consolidation and promotion of food-serving business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Maintaining his coconut farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying and selling of cell phone accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying and selling shoes

loans.name: Jenny Juana

texts.es:
La Señora Jenny  es una  cliente buena, ella  ya trabajo tres secuencias en la institución, en su comportamiento ella demostró puntualidad y responsabilidad, la señora Jenny se dedica a la venta de ropa de mujer de pollera ( en Bolivia la mujer autóctona es la que utiliza polleras y mantas, la venta de polleras y mantas se da mas en la zona occidental del país, la señora Jenny compra ropa de las tiendas que alquilan esta ropa para bailes, la venta lo realiza en la zona 12 de octubre, esta zona es muy popular de la ciudad de el alto porque no se debe pagar para realizar la venta, en estos puestos lo que mas se vende es la ropa de mujer de pollera, su esposo se llama Antonio el es chofer asalariado del sindicato Pedro Domingo murillo,  la labor de la señora Jenny es sacrificado porque ella no solo tiene que realizar la venta de su ropa sino también  ella ayuda a su esposo en su movilidad cobrando pasajes, el destino del crédito es para la compra de ropa por mayor.
Esta agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Jenny is a good client. She has already worked three cycles with the institution. Her behavior demonstrated punctuality and responsibility. Jenny sells women’s clothes. In Bolivia an Autócona woman is one who wears “polleras” (a traditional long skirt) and “mantas” (shawls). These polleras and mantas are sold more in the western part of the country. Jennny buys clothes from the stores that rent clothing for dances. She sells in the 12 de octubre region. This region is very popular in the city of El Alto because you do not have to pay to sell. At these stands the pollera is what sells the most. Her husband, Antonio, is a salaried driver for the Pedro Domingo Murillo union. Jenny makes lots of sacrifices in her work because she not only sells clothes, but she also helps her husband by collecting fares for his transportation service. The loan is to buy clothes wholesale. She is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they show by giving her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes wholesale

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Sonia tiene 31 años de edad, su negocio es una pequeña pulpería en donde vende una variedad de productos pero en especial es la venta de ajo que compra por mayor  lleva muchos años en el negocio, todo comenzó cuando se caso,  el negocio de su esposo era la venta de ajo por mayor, junto a el procrearon  tres hijos los cuales cursan sus estudios. Y gracias a muchos esfuerzos hicieron su casa en donde falta repellar las paredes, poner piso, han ido mejorando poco a poco debido a la falta de dinero para terminar ya que todo ha incrementado y los prestamos han sido para el comercio. Con este financiamiento comprara: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón, ace, golosinas, gaseosas, productos lácteos, a si como caja de ajos para comercializar y ofrecer a sus clientes, el cual espere se mejoren las ventas ya que en los últimos meses ha vendido poco,  es por eso desea invertir en su pulpería para obtener mejores resultados.
texts.en:
Señora Sonia is 31 and has a small grocery store where she sells a variety of products. She specializes in the sale of garlic, which she buys wholesale. She has had this business for many years. She started it when she got married. Her husband's business was selling garlic wholesale. They have three children who are in school. Thanks to a lot of effort, they made their home that still needs plaster on the walls and a floor. They have improved it little by little but due to a lack of money, they still need to finish it since prices have increased, and they have put their loans toward their business. With this loan, she will buy: rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, candy, soft drinks, dairy products, and boxes of garlic to sell and to offer to her customers. She hopes this will improve her sales since in the last few months she hasn't sold much. This is why she wants to invest in her store to achieve better results.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, dairy products, and boxes of garlic to increase her sales

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a small businessman from Pavlograd. He has been in the confectionery sales business for only 4 months. He likes working with this type of merchandise and always offers only high quality products to his customers. Alexander makes about 5,000 grivnyas in profit each month.

Alexander is seeking a 6,000 grivnya loan to fix the car that he uses for transportation of merchandise from wholesalers to his vending location. It will facilitate his trade and help him meet clients’ demand. Alexander is hoping to further grow and develop his venture and reach self-sustainability in the future.

loans.use: To do some repairs on his vehicle

loans.name: Jose Domingo

texts.es: Don Domingo tiene la edad de 34 años, casado, vive en el bario Batahola Norte, su esposa  tiene un hijo de 9 días nacido. El trabaja para la empresa serví pro, como guarda de seguridad, antes trabajaba como policía, y tenia un cargo en antifraude. Pero por motivo de peligro decidió salirse, por falta de dinero no ha logrado construir su propia casa y vive junto con sus padres es por eso la necesidad de ampliar su cuarto con el nacimiento de su primer hijo ya que esta contento y desea dar las mejores condiciones para su pequeña familia. Este es su primer financiamiento el cual comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, hierro, cemento, arena, zinc para poder comenzar la obra y gozar de privacidad. a futuro es lograr poder tener su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Domingo is 34 years old, married, and lives in the neighborhood of North Batahola. His wife had a son nine days ago. He works for the business Servípro as a security guard. Before that he was a policeman working in antifraud. However, because of danger he decided to leave that job. Because of his lack of money, he has not been able to build his own house, so he lives with his parents. Because of the birth of his first son, he needs to widen his room in the house since he is content and wants to give the best possible conditions to his small family. This is his first loan, with which he will buy construction materials such as: stone, iron, cement, sand, and zinc in order to start his work and enjoy privacy. His goal is to be able to have his own house.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase stone, sand, cement, iron, and zinc to begin working

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy D. est une femme de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis mars 2002 et a une bonne expérience dans son domaine d'activité (l'embouche bovine) pour l'avoir mené pendant plus de 5 ans. Son objectif est de mieux développer son activité et de prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Amy D. is a woman of 46. She is married and the mother of six children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois since March of 2002 and has good experience in her business area (the fattening of cattle), which has enabled her to lead the enterprise for over 5 years. Her goal is to better develop her business and to support her family.

Translated from French by Carolyn McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married with two grown children. She lives in Novaya Kahovka and has a small business selling souvenirs. Victoria has several vending locations at the markets and in the local mall called “Tsentralnyi” (“Central”). Presently, Victoria has about 20,000 grivnyas in capital turnover. Her net profit amounts to 6,500 grivnyas.

Victoria is seeking a 15,000 grivnya loan to purchase additional merchandise and diversify its assortment. She has been in this business for 8 years. She knows how to please her customers and meet their needs. Victoria enjoys working with people and this type of merchandise. She is hoping to see her business expand and flourish in the future as well.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Alyeris Maria

texts.es: La joven Alyeris de 26 años de edad, habita junto con sus padres, es una joven de iniciativa que ha logrado tener su propio negocio en venta de ropa, cosméticos y prenda de plata y oro laminado. Todo esto con el propósito de tener su propio dinero y no depender solo de sus padres, lleva  siete años en las ventas, en donde ha hecho mucha clientela que le hacen encargo, vende al contado y al crédito. Lo único es que muchos clientes abecés le atrasan el pago y eso le perjudica por que trabaja con poco capital. La mercancía la tiene en su cuarto el cual se le hace incomodo. Su necesidad es poder hacer un local pequeño en donde pueda tener su propia venta. Lo cual comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc, perlines y comenzar la obra. Gracias a estos préstamos ha logrado mantener su venta de prendas el cual inicio con el apoyo de Afodenic y es su once avo crédito y esta logrando cada día mejoras en su vida.
texts.en:
Alyeris is 26 years old and lives with her parents. This young woman took the initiative to start her own business selling clothing, cosmetics, and gold and silver laminated garments. Alyeris started this business so that she could earn her own money and not become dependent on her parents. She has been making sales for seven years. Her customers place their orders with her and she accepts payments by cash or on credit. The only problem is that many of her customers delay their payments, which hurts her because she is left with little available capital.

Alyeris stores her merchandise in her room, which makes it uncomfortable. She needs to have a location from where she can sell her products. For this reason, Alyeris will purchase materials such as stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc, and crossbeams so that she can begin construction. Thanks to her previous loans, she has been able to maintain the sales business that she started. With the support of AFODENIC, Alyeris will receive her eleventh loan which will help her continue making improvements in her life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a location where she can sell her merchandise

loans.name: Francisca Anabel

texts.es: Francisca es casada, trabaja como comerciante de productos lacteos junto a su marido desde hace 10 años, ademas cuenta con un poco de inventario ganadero que le permite el sustento familiar, vive en la zona # 5 de Nueva Guinea desde hace 15 años, esta solicitando su 1er credito a la institucion de AFODENIC para ser invertido en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos lacteos, pues requiere aumentar su compra de estos productgos en las comunidades de Nueva Guinea para satisfacer la demanda de su clientela de Managua.  En su comunidad la consideran como una persona de buenos valores morales y honesta, tiene buenas referencias comerciales de otras instituciones financieras, su mayor sueño es de aumentar su capital de trabajo y de esta manera sacar adeante a sus hijos en la educacion.
texts.en:
Francisca is married and has been working with her husband as a dairy products trader for the past ten years. In addition, she raises livestock in order to maintain her family’s livelihood. Francisca has lived in District #5 of New Guinea for fifteen years.

She is requesting her first loan from AFODENIC so that she can invest in her small business selling dairy products. Francisca will increase her inventory by purchasing products in the community of Nueva Guinea so that she can meet the demand of her customers in Managua. In her community, she is considered to be an honest person with good morals. Francisca presents good references from other financial institutions. Her greatest dream is to increase her operating capital so that her children can succeed in their education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dairy products to sell

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is single. She lives in Berdyansk. Natalya sells children’s clothing in one of the biggest markets of her hometown. She offers trendy merchandise at affordable prices, which has always been main attraction for her customers. Natalya has been in this business for eight years. Currently, she has 20,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. Her monthly profit amounts to 2,500 Grivnyas.  

Natalya is requesting a 15,000 Grivnya loan to increase her turnover capital and purchase additional merchandise at wholesale prices for further retail sale in her kiosk. Natalya can be characterized as a hard-working entrepreneur with a clear vision and integrity. She is talented and knowledgeable in business management. We believe Natalya’s business will benefit from her current loan and will continue growing in the future.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Esperanza De Callapa Group

texts.es:
ESPERANZA D. CALLAPA es un banco que se formo en la zona D. Callapa, una zona muy alejada D. la ciudad que aun no esta urbanizada, se dedican a distintas actividades con las cuales sostiene a sus familias, su mesa directiva consta D. tres personas que fueron elegidas por decision D. la asamblea.

Como presidenta esta la Sra Olga Quien tiene una tienda D. barrio y usara el prestamo par agrandar este negocio, y La Sra Miriam Que se dedica a la venta D. leche ademas que se dedica a la criansa D. animales, tambien esta la Srta Willma  que se dedica a la venta D. cosmeticos por catalogo en la zona D. Irpavi. los demas integrantes se dedican a otras y distintas actividades como el Sr Dario que es albañil constructor, la Sra Maria  que se dedica a la venta D. ropa en las ferias, Mercedes venD. verduras, La sra Maria que realiza compra y venta D. abarrotes, tambien forma parte del banco el Sr Silverio que se dedica a la elaboracion D. pan, la Sra Anastacia  que venD. leche por las distintas zonas y el Sr Nelson que trabaja en una panaderia. Todos ellos son personas dinamicas y responsables que se garantizan entre si.

Estan muy agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Esperanza D. Callapa is a bank that was established in the Callapa region. This region is very far from the city, and it is still not urbanized. They work in different activities, which support their families. The governing board consists of three people who were elected by the members. Olga Quien is the president. She has a neighborhood store, and she will use the loan to expand her business. Miriam Que sells milk and raises animals. There is also Willma who sells cosmetics by catalog in the Irpavi region. The other members work at different activities. Dario is a bricklayer, Maria sells clothes at the fairs, and Mercedes sells vegetables. Maria buys and sells groceries. Silverio is also part of the bank, and he makes bread. Anastacia sells milk in different regions. Nelson works in a bakery. All of them are dynamic and responsible people, and they guarantee each other. They are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in giving them the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es: Ximara vive en la zona # 7 de Nueva Guinea, sus hijos son mayores, solo una niña es menor de edad que habita junto a ella, labora como gerente de la empresa Vogue de Nueva Guinea donde vende cosmeticos, esta solicitando su primer credto a la institucion de AFODENIC para realizar mejoras a su vivienda construyendo una tapia y embaldozado de vivienda, lo que le permitira darle mayor seguridad y mejores condiciones a su casa.  Tiene buenas referencias comerciales con otras instuciones financieras, ademas se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, con alto espiritu de superacion y muy responsable.
texts.en:
Xiomara lives in District #7 of Nueva Guinea. Her sons are grown, but her only daughter is still a dependent and lives with her. Xiomara works as a manager for a company called “Vogue” in Nueva Guinea, where she sells cosmetics.

She is requesting her first loan from AFODENIC and will use the funds to make improvements to her home. She plans to construct a wall and install a tile floor in her house, which will provide greater security and better living conditions. Xiomara has good references from other financial institutions. She is known for being a hardworking woman, who is very responsible and determined to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall & install a tile floor

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es: El señor Abraham tiene 42 años de edad, desde joven logro formar su familia el cual su esposa procreo tres hijos, su trabajo es la venta de especies de manzanilla y canela al por mayor el cual lleva siete años en las ventas, el trabajaba antes en el mismo oficio  de especies pero renuncio el cual puso su pequeña venta y poco a poco fue captando clientes  lo cual se vende mucho por ser medicinales, por ser buenas y de bajo costo. Sus ventas han estado bajas en las últimas semanas, como todo ha incrementado las ventas bajaron, todo esto se debe a la crisis que el país esta pasando poco, empleo y mal pagados. Su necesidad es poder cerrar bien su terreno ya que poco a poco ha venido haciendo el muro por toda su propiedad. Pero a un le falta es por eso comprara el resto de materiales  para terminar el muro ya que el aun tiene material es por eso solo  comprara: cemento, arena, piedrin y pagar la mano de obra para terminar su muro y estar con mejor seguridad de la delincuencia que asecha el barrio. Estos créditos han sido solo para mejorar su vivienda con el crédito anterior pudo mejorar su pequeña y humilde casa. Para el es importante cerrar todo su terreno para luego continuar mejorando su casa.  El cual esta contento por poder lograr sus objetivos, gracias al financiamiento de Afodenic.
texts.en:
Sr. Abraham is 42 years old. He and his wife started their family at a young age and now they have three children. Abraham has been selling chamomile and cinnamon wholesale for the past seven years. He previously sold these products before, but he gave it up when he attracted more customers selling medicine, which he was able to acquire at low cost and generate good sales. Within the past few weeks, his sales have gone down. Prices have increased on everything as a result of the financial crisis the country is experiencing. There are few jobs and workers are underpaid.

Abraham wants to enclose his land, so he started building a wall around his property. However, he lacks the remaining materials to finish the wall. He needs to buy cement, sand, and gravel and also pay for labor. A completed wall will provide better security against the crime that is plaguing the neighborhood. His previous loans have been the only means in which Abraham has been able to make improvements to his small modest home. It is important to enclose his land so that he can continue making improvements to his house at a later time. He is happy that he is able to achieve his objectives, thanks to the financing provided by AFODENIC.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to finish building a wall

loans.name: Satou Ibou

texts.fr: Satou Ibra F. est une femme de 47 ans, elle mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 3 ans. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine depuis plus de 3 ans. Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et d'aider à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Satou Ibra F. is a woman of 47 years. She is married and the mother of six children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois for three years. She has worked in the fattening of cattle for over three years. Her goal is to strengthen her savings and help to support her family.

Translated from French by Carolyn McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen and promote her business

loans.name: Carolina Del Pilar

texts.es:
Carolina tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera, la mayor de cuatro hermanos y vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el caserío La Legua, del distrito de Catacaos, provincia de Piura en la región Piura, ubicada a 3 horas y 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Gracias a sus ahorros pudo instalar una pequeña bodega en casa de sus padres. Ella nos cuenta que la iniciativa de este negocio nació debido a que quería apoyar a sus padres en el sostenimiento de su hogar y en la educación de sus hermanos. En su establecimiento Carolina ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de abarrotes y bebidas.

Carolina desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos para ofrecérselos en venta a sus clientes, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Carolina es una joven responsable, activa y muy emprendedora. Su más grande anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria hasta llegar a tener un minimarket en su domicilio
texts.en:
Carolina is 20 years old, single, and the oldest of four siblings. She lives at home with her parents in the village of La Legua in the District of Catacaos, Piura Province. This community is located three hours and twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Using her savings, Carolina opened a small grocery store in her parents’ house. She tells us she started this business because she wanted to help her parents with the household expenses and the education of her siblings. Her store offers her customers all types of groceries and beverages.

Carolina wants to expand her business by purchasing more products to offer to her customers, but she does not have sufficient capital to take further action. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles so that she can achieve her objective.

Carolina is a responsible, active, and enterprising young woman. Her greatest dream is to continue growing her business to the point when she can convert it into a mini-market.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Luz Y Vida Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento LUZ Y VIDA es un banco que esta conformado por 10 Integrantes y las  socias se dedican al comercio y venta D. comida.

El Sr.MIGUEL es el presidente del Banco y se dedica a la venta D. material electrico y con el prestamo lograra comprar más mercaderia y aumento D. capital D. trabajo y para mejorar sus ingresos ecónomicos.

La Sra. MIKAELA es la secretaria en el Banco y ella se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza y ropa, con el prestamo comprar más mercaderias como ser perfumes, talcos,desodorantes y otros y D. esta forma mejorara sus ingresos, es estudiante D. la carrera D. informatica en la UMSA 

La Sra. CARMEN ella es la tesorera del banco y tiene tres hijos y se dedica a la venta D. comida en el calle Sebastian, tiene su pensión y el prestamo se invertirá en compra D. lnsumos requeridos para su venta y así para poder mejorar su calidad D. vida y aumento D. capital D. trabajo.

Todos los integrantes del grupo son dinamicos trabajadores y responsables, se garantizan entre ellos. 

Estan muy agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Entrepreneur's Bank LUZ Y VIDA is a bank comprised of 10 members, and they specialize in trades and the sale of food. Miguel is the bank president, and he sells electrical materials, and with this loan he will be able to buy more merchandise and increase his working capital in order to earn a better income. Mikaela is the bank secretary, and she sells clothes and beauty products. With this loan she can buy more merchandise such as perfumes, powders, deodorants, and more, and in this way improve her income. She is also a student in the IT program at UMSA (Universidad Mayor D. San Andrés). Carmen is the bank's treasurer. She has three children and sells food on Sebastian Street. She has a pension, and the loan will be invested in buying the necessary products for her sales, and in that way she can better her quality of life and increase her working capital. All of the mermbers of the group are dynamic and responsible workers, and they guarantee this among themselves. They are very appreciative of Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they grant through the lending of credit.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Chacap Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Chacap se dedican a la elaboraciòn y venta de guipiles y blusas, han trabajado durante 6 años atras  y con esT. han salido avante, pero viendo la gran necesidad de apliar sus capitales y cubrir sus demandas acuden a la Asociaciòn de ASDIR para que se les apoye, en sus capitales, son mujeres muy trabajadoras que piensan superar y apoyara a sus familias, y como tambien desean realizar sus distintos sueños y quieren ver a sus hijos graduados en sus estudios, y tener una casa digna.
Este grupo de señoras se encuentra un lugar llamado Chacap es una aldea  de solola muy Pobre a pèsar de ello ellas visitan y realizar venta en otros lugares.-
texts.en:
The Chacap Group engages in the manufacture and sale of “huipiles” and blouses. They have working for six years and are successful in this endeavor, but they need T. increase their capital in order T. keep up with demand. For this reason, they have come T. Asociaciòn ASDIR for assistance in accessing more capital. The women work very hard T. overcome obstacles and support their families. They also have different dreams that they want T. pursue, such as seeing their children complete their education and owning a decent home.

These women live in a place called Chacap, an isolated village that is very poor. Despite their location, they are able T. visit other places in order T. sell their products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making traditional blouses

loans.name: Alamos Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento ALAMOS, es una asociacion D. la zona D. Alto Irpavi (Peña Azul) una zona que no esta urbanizada a la cual aun no tiene ingreso el transporte publico, las socias se reunen en la casa D. la Sra Maria que tiene su tienda D. barrio en la misma casa, en su mayoria son personas que se dedican a la crianza D. vacas y la venta D. leche.

Se organizan D. una mesa directiva la cual esta compuesta por La sra Rebeca Presidenta quien se dedica a la venta D. salchipapas en un kiosko, La Tesorera es la Sra. Angela que venD. cosmeticos por catalogo, y como secretaria esta la Sra.  Celia  que trabaja en labores D. casa. los demas socios tienes actividades distintas como Venta D. Leche las Sra. Gloria y la sra Juana, crianza D. animales, la Sra. Lidia, Jose es Transportistas al igual que los Sres. Joaquin  y el sr Felix,  Control D. movilidades el Sr. Lucio, Venta D. Pollos la Sra. Elizabeth, en su mayoria no cuentan con un negocio estable pero el prestamo sera invertido en el incremento D. capital D. trabajo y asi obtener estabilidad economica en sus hogares.
texts.en:
The ALAMOS communal bank is located in the Alto Irpavi (Peña Azul) zone. This area isn't urbanized yet; there is no public transport access. The members meet in Maria's house. She has a neighborhood grocery store in her home. Most members are dairy farmers. The governing board is maD. up as follows: Rebeca is president; she sells salchipapas (a type of fast food that consists of thinly sliced pan-fried beef hot dogs or sausage and French fries, mixed together and served on a plate or in a paper cone, served with different sauces) in a food stand. Angela is treasurer; she sells catalogue cosmetics. Celia is secretary and works as a domestic. The other members have various lines of work like: Milk sales (Gloria and Juana), small animal raising (Lidia), transportation services (Jose, Joaquin and Felix), vehicle control (Lucio), chicken sales (Elizabeth). For the most part, they don't have stable businesses so the loan will be used to invest in working capital so as to obtain better economic stability for their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital increase.

loans.name: Las Siete Rosas Group

texts.es: El grupo las siete rosas, se han dedicado por 4 años atras en la elaboraciòn y venta de blusas y fajas de artesanias, ya que con esto se han sostenido a ellas y a sus hijos, en este año 2010 se han propuesto a vistar a otros pueblos y aldeas para vender sus productos pero esto implica surtir sus ventas por lo cual ellas acuden a la Asociaciòn Asdir para que se le pueda apoyar en ampliar sus capitales y asi tener el sueño realizado y ellas relatan que entre màs surtido tengan las ventas màs realizan y quieren susperar y apoyar a sus familias a salir avante,y el deseo es tener una buena con dicion de vida.
texts.en:
The Group “Las Siete Rosas” (The Seven Roses) has been producing handmade blouses and corsets for four years, which enable them to support themselves and their children. For 2010, they are proposing to visit other villages and neighborhoods to sell their products. However, they need more supplies in order to make this happen. For this reason, they have come to Asociaciòn ASDIR for assistance with accessing more capital so that they can fulfill this dream. They hope to increase their sales so that they can support their families, help them get ahead, and provide them better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & supplies

loans.name: Reyes Carvajal Group

texts.es:
REYES CARVAJAL es un Banco D. Emprendimiento que ingresa a su segundo ciclo sin tener dificultad D. pago en su inicio, son personas D. la misma zona con distintas actividades, muchos D. ellos no cuentan con un negocio establecido pero con el prestamo iniciaran uno, cuentan con una mesa directiva elegida democraticamente por asamblea en la que salio elegida como presidenta la Sra Daria que tiene su negocio D. venta D. comida en la parada del minibus "263".

Como Tesorera esta la Sra. Florentina que se dedica a la venta D. golosinas.

La Secretaria es la sra Estela que trabaja en labores D. casa. desarrollan tambien otras actividades.

Como parte D. la base del banco se encuentra la srta Mariela que venD. ropa, el Sr. Edgar  se dedica a la reparacion D. celulares, el Sr. Heriberto trabaja en el club D. golf, la Sra. Monica  venD. comida con su madre,el Sr. Vicente Trabaja como mecanico en un taller D. automoviles, la Sra. Veronica trabaja como empleada domestica, por ultimo esta la Sra. Virginia que se dedica a la atencion en una tienda D. Fotocopias. con estas actividades ellos sostienen a sus familias esperan tener un mejor futuro para sus hijos.

Todos ellos estan agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Reyes Carvajal is communal bank that has entered its 2nd loan cycle without having any difficulties with payments during the first cycle. The members are from the same area but are involved in different activities; most of them do not have an established business but with the loan they will start one. They have a board that was elected democratically by assembly, in which Daria was elected president. She has a business selling food next to the bus stop for minibus "263." Florentina was elected treasurer; she sells candy. Estela is the secretary, and she is a homemaker. The group is also developing other activities. The foundation of the group is formed by Mariela, who sells clothing, Edgar, who repairs cellular phones, Heriberto, who works at a golf club, Monica, who sells food with her mother, Vincent, who works as a mechanic in an auto repair shop, Veronica, who works as a domestic, and finally Virginia, who works in a photocopy shop. With these activities they support their families and hope to have a better future for their children. All of them are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence provided in the granting of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La Srta. Veronia tiene como actividad la elaboracion y venta de empanadas tucumanas, distribuyendo las mismas por mayor, surtiendo diferentes pedidos de sus clientes, realiza esta actividad conjuntamente con su mamá Sra. Filomena, elaboran  las empanadas tucumanas en su domicilio y luego realizan la entrega a sus clientes.

Esta actividad se constituyendose en su principal fuente de ingreso para ella y su madre, que viven en casa de su hijo mayor. El destino del credito para la compra de un refrigerador, un meson de panaderia, una cocina industrial y menaje de cocina.

Esta agradecida con Emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Veronica makes and sells beef empanadas, and distributes them wholesale. She supplies different orders from her customers, carrying out this activity together with her mother, Senora Filomena. They make the beef empanadas in their home and then later deliver them to their customers. This activity constitutes the main source of income for Veronica and her mother, who live in the home of the family's oldest son. This loan will be used to buy a refrigerator, a bakery table, an industrial oven and kitchenware. They are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, a bakery table, an industrial oven and kitchenware

loans.name: Kémé

texts.fr: Kémé D. est une femme mariée, elle âgée de 41 ans et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc villageois depuis 9 ans et a une bonne expérience en matière de crédit pour y avoir accédé à 18 fois de suite. Ce prêt lui permettra de poursuivre sa vente de jus naturels, de glace, de draps de lit et rideaux et de pouvoir participer aux différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
Kémé D. is a married woman, aged 41, and the mother of six children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois for nine years, and has good experience in terms of loans for having obtained 18 of them in succession. This loan will allow her to continue her sales of natural juices, ice, bed sheets, and curtains, and enable her to contribute to various familial expenses.

Translated from French by Carolyn McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her investment capital

loans.name: Xiomara Indiana

texts.es: Doña Xiomara tiene 58 años de edad, es una mujer dedicada al negocio que durante varios años ah logrado la captación de clientes, ya que vende una variedad de productos como: comida, hace pupusa, cosméticos, ropa y zapatos todo lo que le genere ingreso. Procreo seis hijos, de los cuales solo uno estudia en la universidad, su esposo es comerciante de repuestos de vehículos, en donde ha recibido su apoyo para crecer en su negocio ya que comparten los gastos, también la institución en donde ha logrado junto a ella su crecimiento. Ya que ha podido vender  variedad de venta de comida, cosmético, ropa y zapatos aumentado su clientela como sus disponibilidad. Con este financiamiento quiere invertir en ropa escolar desde falda, pantalones, camisas, calcetas, zapatos así como una cocina de plancha para hacer pupusa, ella ya tiene una pero desea otra para no atrasar al cliente ya que tiene pensado ubicarse en el parque de la colonia Máximo Jerez para vender pupusa que se venden bien por se rica y baratas en nuestra capital de Managua. Ya que cosmético tiene . A futuro es poder poner un local en su casa con vitrinas para exhibir su venta.
texts.en:
Doña Xiomara is 58 years old. She has been dedicated to a number of businesses selling items such as food, pupusas, cosmetics, clothing, and shoes in order to generate income. She has raised six children, of whom one is a university student. Her husband is a merchant who sells vehicle spare parts. He provide supports to her business and helps with covering the household expenses. In addition, the Institution has helped her grow her business. Since she has been able to sell a wide variety of products, her clientele has increased as well as her available resources.

With this loan, Xiomara will purchase school clothes including skirts, pants, shirts, socks, and shoes. She will also acquire a cooking grill for preparing pupusas. She already has one, but another one is needed so that she can keep up with customer demand. Xiomara currently sells her products at the park in the Máximo Jerez division. Her pupusas sell very well because of the rich flavor and their prices are cheaper than those sold in the capital city of Managua. She also sells cosmetics at the same location. In the future, she want to equip a location in her home with display cases so that she can exhibit her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school clothing & a cooking grill

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia, de 36 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo William, de 37 años, y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.
La elaboración de ladrillos es la actividad a la que se dedica, su horno está ubicado en las afueras de la ciudad de Juliaca. Ella se levanta muy temprano, y junto a su esposo comienzan con el amasado y moldeado del barro, para luego dejarlo secar por 10 días y meterlo al horno.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender sus ladrillos, ya que siente que su trabajo es recompensado. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trabajar sin importar el clima, puesto que muchas veces el sol hace que el trabajo sea más pesado o la lluvia impide que los ladrillos se moldeen correctamente, aun así ella continua trabajando duro para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Para más adelante, desea implementar una bodega en su casa, ya que actualmente hay muy pocas por su barrio.

Este es el tercer préstamo al que accede con MFP y al igual como hizo con sus anteriores préstamos, desea pagarlo a tiempo y sin dificultades. En su banco comunal es muy respetada, ya que es la socia más activa y comprometida. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos moldes para ladrillos de techo, ya que es lo que más le solicitan.
texts.en:
Antonia is 36 years old and a hardworking, determined woman. She lives in her own house with her husband William, who is 37. They both wish to succeed in life.

Antonia engages in the manufacture of bricks. Her oven is located on the outskirts of the city of Juliaca. Together with her husband, she wakes up early in the morning to begin kneading and molding the clay before letting it dry for ten days prior to baking in the oven. What she enjoys most about her job is selling the bricks, which is the point in which she feels rewarded for her work. Antonio has been in this business for ten years and believes the most difficult part is dealing with the weather. Many times while working in the sun, the work becomes more difficult. When it rains, she is not able to mold the bricks correctly. Nevertheless, she continues to work hard in order to improve her quality of life. In the future, she would like to open a grocery store in her house because there are few in her neighborhood.

This is the third loan that she has accessed from MFP. Just like her previous loans, Antonia wants to make her payments on time and with little difficulty. She is highly respected by her Communal Bank because she is one of the most active and committed members. With her loan of 3000 soles, she plans to buy new molds for making roofing bricks since these are the type that are most requested.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase molds for making bricks

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío Biluña, distrito de Olmos, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar como obrero agrícola en un fundo de la zona, pero como esta actividad no le provee de ingresos suficientes para colaborar con la economía de su hogar y solventar sus gastos personales, hace un año adquirió una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el trasnporte de carga y pasajeros) con la que trabaja en sus tiempos libres. El trabaja su vehículo cubriendo rutas que unen su caserío con las zonas aledañas.

Debido a que los caminos de la zona son accidentados, el vehículo de Luis ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas de origen mecánico que necesitan de urgente reparación. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan hacer las repaciones y mantenimiento necesarias para que su vehículo funcione correctamente.

El es un joven responsable y muy trabajador. Su más grande anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder adquirirse un terreno de cultivo propio.
texts.en:
Luis is 28 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the village of Biluña in Olmos District, located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

Luis works as an agricultural laborer at a local farm, but this job does not provide sufficient income to cover both his household and personal expenses. A year ago, he bought a motorcycle taxi and began providing transport services (of both cargo and passengers) in his spare time. He travels along routes that link his village with the surrounding areas.

Since the local roads are quite rugged, his vehicle has suffered a few mechanical failures that are in need of urgent repair. For this reason, Luis is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternative in the amount of 1000 soles so that he can make repairs and perform necessary maintenance to his vehicle so that it functions correctly.

Luis is a responsible and hardworking young man. His greatest wish is to continue growing as a businessman so that he will be able to purchase his own land.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for mainenance & repairs to his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Jose Dolores

texts.es: El señor Jose Dolores Z. M., tiene 56 años vive en Barrio Medardo Andino, es casado y su esposa se es cajera ellos tiene un hijo, antes tenian bajo su custodia a dos mán pero se independizarón y se quedaron con la tutela del menor, actualmente el muchacho estudia pero trabaja para apoyar en los gastos del hogar, el plan principal de la familia es el realizar mejoras en su vivienda para tener mejores condiciones de vida, el señor se gana el sustento diario como albañil desde hace 20 años, dentro de las principales dificultades que han enfrentado son los ataques de asma que el señor padece y que le afecta más cuando se encuentra en su casa de habitacion, debido a las pauperrimas condiciones en las que habita que aunmentan las posibilidades de ataques con más freuencia, es por esta razon que la familia solicita este prestamo para realizar remodelaciones en su hogar con el credito comprarian materiales de construccion para comenzar con la remodelacion de corredor de su casa esto garantizara la buena salud del señor y la tranquilidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Dolores Z. M. is 56 years old and lives in the Medardo Andino neighborhood. He is married, and his wife is a cashier. They have one child at home; previously, they had two more in their care, but those children grew up and became independent, so the couple are now taking care of only the youngest. Currently, the boy is studying, but he is also working to contribute to the household expenses. The family's central plan is to make improvements to their home, in order to raise their quality of life. Jose has earned a living as a mason for 20 years. Among the main difficulties he has faced are the asthma attacks he suffers, which affect him most strongly when he is at home. This is due to the impoverished conditions he lives in, which increase his risk of having more frequent asthma attacks. For this reason, the family is requesting the current loan in order to carry out remodeling work in their home.
