Amilcar works on his farm accompanied by a small radio on which he listens to his beloved “huaynos” (traditional music of the mountains). What he likes most about his work is that the products he plants are in demand in the market, though in order to achieve good quality he has to keep working until late at night.

In spite of the difficulty of his work, he believes it is worthwhile because he can offer an adequate quality of life to his father and is saving in order to buy more land, plant a greater quantity of crops, and build his own house where he can start his own family.

This is his second loan with MFP, and he is sure that he will pay his installments on time, just as he did with his first loan. At the same time, he is happy working with the people in his communal bank because he is working with friends who are very responsible. With the money that he is now applying for he will buy several sacks of fertilizer and three bottles of insecticide in order to fertilize and treat his potato field.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Ángel es un hombre muy trabajador de 36 años, está felizmente casado con Ana, de 28 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos: Keyla de 9 y Kaola de 6 años. Esta linda familia vive en su casa propia ubicada en un pueblo llamado Cumutay en la sierra peruana.

Él sabe que todo en la vida cuesta, porque trabajó de peón desde muy niño y las penas que vivía a diario hicieron en un principio que se sienta resentido con sus padres y con él mismo, porque no podía estudiar como los demás niños, ni jugar, pero siendo adolescente entendió que sus padres siempre se esforzaban por darle lo mejor pero no les alcanzaba.
Por eso, desde hace 20 años, se dedica exclusivamente a la siembra de papa, en sus propios terrenos y en otros arrendados, con la ayuda de su amada esposa, pues no quiere que a sus hijas les falte nada, de lo que él careció.
De su trabajo, lo que le gusta es la siembra, además considera que su trabajo es rentable porque le permite cubrir los gastos de su vivienda, las primeras necesidades de su familia y ahorrar para más adelante. 
Para el futuro, Ángel planea sembrar en mayor cantidad y emprender un negocio de venta de tubérculos y arveja como mayorista.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual y responsable en cada pago, además asegura que le gusta trabajar con los integrantes de su banco comunal porque los conoce. Ángel se siente muy orgulloso de los logros que ha ido obteniendo, por eso con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará dos bolsas de semilla de arvejas y dos sacos de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Ángel is a very hard-working man of 36. He is happily married to Ana, 28, with whom he has 2 children: Keyla, 9, and Kaola, 6. This beautiful family lives in their own home, located in a village called Cumutay in the Peruvian mountain range. Ángel knows that everything in life costs money, because since he was little he worked as a labourer, and the daily hardships he faced initially created a feeling of resentment towards his parents and himself, because he couldn't study like all the other children, or even play. But, being an adolescent, he understood that his parents always strived to give him the best, but just couldn't make it. Because of this experience, 20 years ago, Ángel works exclusively growing potatoes in his own land and other leased land with the help of his beloved wife, because he doesn't want his children to lack anything, as he did. In his work, Ángel likes sowing the potatoes, and he also considers his job to be profitable because it permits him to cover his household costs, the primary necessities of his family and save some money for the future. In the future, Ángel plans to sow in greater quantity and start a business selling tubers and peas wholesale. This is the first loan he has had with MFP and he promises to be punctual and responsible with each payment. He also assures us that he enjoys working with the members of his communal bank because he knows them. Ángel feels very proud of the goals he has achieved, and with the money he is now seeking he will buy 2 bags of pea seeds and 2 sacks of fertilisers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilisers

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica tiene 36 años, está felizmente casada con Luis, de 32 años. Ambos tienen tres hijos: Miguel de 10,  Noelia de 4 y Heidi de 1 año, todos viven en un apacible lugar de la sierra del Perú donde no existe muchas vías de comunicación. 

Para sacar adelante a su familia ella y su esposo trabajan muy duro en la chacra, sembrando papa, arveja, habas y maíz desde hace 10 años. Asimismo, cría animales los cuales vende luego de engordarlos.
Angélica cuenta que de todo su trabajo le gusta más cosechar y comercializar sus productos porque ve el fruto de su sacrifico, además desde que empezó a vivir con su esposo no se queja de las ganancias que obtiene porque le permite sostener su vivienda y educar a sus hijos.
Por ello, para el futuro planea comprar más terrenos agrícolas y cerdos para criar.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser responsable y pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Por otro lado, le gusta la idea de trabajar en grupo, más aún con su banco comunal que son personas que conoce. En busca de más ganancias económicas que le brinden bienestar a su hijos, con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará ½ saco de semilla de papa, ½ bolsa de semilla de arveja y un saco de abono.
texts.en:
Angélica is 36 years old. She is happily married to Luis, 32. Both have 3 children: Miguel, 10, Noelia, 4, and Heidi, 1. All live in a peaceful spot in the Peruvian mountain range where there aren't many channels of communication. To keep her family going, for the last 10 years Angélica and her husband have worked very hard on their farm, sowing potato, peas, broad beans and maize. She also breeds animals which she sells after fattening them. Angélica says that out of all her work, she most enjoys harvesting and selling her products because she sees the fruit of her labours. Also, since she began living with her husband he doesn't complain about the earnings she obtains because they permit her to maintain their home and educate their children. In the future she plans to purchase more agricultural land and pigs for breeding. This is the first loan Angélica will take out with MFP, and she promises to be responsible and make her repayments punctually. She liks the idea of working in a group, more so because her communal bank members are people that she knows. In the search for greater economic earnings that grant well-being to her children, with the money that she is now seeking she will buy half a sack of potato seeds, half a bag of pea seeds, and a sack of fertiliser.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilisers

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de 26 años, que vive con su esposo Marcelino, de 29 años, y con sus dos hijos; Liden de 5 y Hugo de 1 año. Ellos viven en una humilde casa (propia) bastante antigua donde vivieron 3 generaciones de su familia.

El trabajo sacrificado que ejerce a diario ha hecho que ella aparente una edad mayor a la que tiene, puesto que se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra papa, arveja maíz y flor de gladiolo desde hace 10 años, con la ayuda de su esposo. Lo que más le gusta es sembrar arveja porque le resulta de poca inversión y puede cosechar hasta 3 veces.
Ella considera que la agricultura una actividad rentable porque le permite cubrir los gastos de su casa y las primeras necesidades de toda su familia.
Por tal motivo, para el futuro desea tener una tienda de comestibles en la ciudad y para ello ya está buscando un local adecuado para alquilar. Sin embargo, Carmen no quiere dejar de sembrar, sino por el contrario quiere aumentar su producción.

Es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y le gusta trabajar con los integrantes de su banco comunal porque son bastante unidos y solidarios. Para cubrir esta campaña agrícola y en busca de ganancias económicas, invertirá el dinero que ahora solicita en la comprar de una bolsa de semilla de arveja,  2 sacos de fertilizantes y una botella de insecticida.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 26-year-old woman who lives with her husband, Marcelino, age 29, and their two children: Liden, age 5, and Hugo, age 1. They live in a humble house that they own; the house is quite old, and three generations of their family have lived there. The self-sacrificing work that Carmen carries out every day has made her appear older than her true years. She works as a farmer, growing potatoes, peas, corn and gladiolus flowers for the past 10 years, with her husband's help. What she likes best is growing peas, because they do not require a large investment, and they can be harvested up to 3 times. Carmen considers farming a profitable activity, because it allows her to cover her household expenses and obtain the basic necessities for everyone in her family. In the future, she would like to open a food store in the city, and she is already looking for a suitable building to rent for this purpose. However, Carmen does not intend to stop farming; on the contrary, she wants to increase her production. This is Carmen's third loan with MFP, and she likes to work with the members of her communal bank, because of their strong unity and solidarity. To cover the expenses of this farming season, and in pursuit of greater economic returns, she will invest the funds she is currently requesting to purchase a bag of pea seeds, two sacks of fertilizer, and a bottle of insecticide.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina tiene 29 años, es una mujer bastante trabajadora y carismática. Está casada y tiene 3 hijos, pero sólo vive con el pequeño Yony de 7 años, porque los demás bajaron a la ciudad en busca de una buena educación. La casa donde ella vive es alquilada.

En la cima de un cerro está ubicada la localidad de Cumutay, provincia Tarma, departamento Junín en centro del Perú. Allí, desde hace 7 años, junto a su esposo, Delfina se dedica a la siembra arveja, papa y maíz. Ambos trabajan incasablemente para cubrir los gastos de educación, comida y vestimenta de sus hijos, además para pagar el arriendo del domicilio donde viven y algunos terrenos donde siembran desde hace algunos años.
De sus labores agrícolas, lo más le gusta es cosechar, para luego trasladar sus productos al mercado mayorista de su ciudad donde los comercializará a buen precio.
Como ella es una mujer emprendedora, para el futuro piensa comprar más terrenos fértiles, sembrar en mayor cantidad y construir su casa propia donde pueda vivir cómodamente y vender los productos que cultiva.      

Este es sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy agradecida por la confianza que le brinda la entidad, también refiere que le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal debido a que aprende varias lecciones en las reuniones que organizan. Antes de efectuar una acción ella piensa muy bien en las consecuencias, por eso con seguridad sabe que invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja, dos sacos de abono orgánico y dos botellas de insecticidas.
texts.en:
Delfina is 29 years old and is a hardworking and charismatic woman. She is married with 3 children, but only the youngest, Yony, who is 7 years old, lives with her. The other children attend school in the city. She currently rents the home where she lives. For 7 years, in a town called Cumutay in the region of Tarma in central Peru, Delfina and her husband have worked cultivating potatoes, corn and other crops. Both of them work tirelessly to cover the costs of their children's education, food and clothing, as well as to pay the rent on their home and on the land they farm. Of their agricultural work, what they like most is the harvest, after which they can transport their products to the wholesale market in the city where they can earn a good price. As Delfina is an enterprising woman, in the future she would like to buy more land to farm, plant in greater quantities and build their own house where they can live comfortably and sell the crops they grow.

This is the 6th loan with MFP, and Delfina is grateful for the confidence MFP has placed in her. She says she also likes working with the communal bank because she learns a lot of valuable lessons in the meetings they organize. Before making decisions and taking action, Delfina thinks carefully about the consequences of those actions. She feels she can safely use this new loan to purchase bags of seeds, sacks of fertilizers and bottles of insecticide.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bags of seeds, sacks of fertilizer and bottles of insecticide.

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.es:
Eliseo tiene 44 años, y desde que enviudó ha sabido ser padre y madre para sus 3 pequeños hijos a quienes cuida como un tesoro. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la selva central del Perú. 

Cuando perdió a su esposa se había dedicado al licor sin pensar en sus hijos, hasta escuchar a diario sus llantos, ahí comprendió que sólo lo tenían a él y que por ellos tenía que salir adelante.
Desde entonces, hace 10 años de dedica a producir plátanos, frutos cítricos y palta en sus propios terrenos y en otros arrendados. Esta labora la realiza con la ayuda de su hijo mayor, pues ha ambos le resulta rentable dedicarse a la agricultura, pues gracias a ello está progresando junto a su familia.
Es por eso que para el futuro desea plantar más productos que crecen en la selva central, además de instalar una tienda de comestibles para que sus hijos, puedan generen sus propios ingresos económicos.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está seguro que pagará el crédito a tiempo para acceder a otros posteriormente, pues quiere seguir el ejemplo de otras personas que progresan con esta metodología crediticia. El dinero que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de plantas de plátanos y abono con el cual acelerará la producción.
texts.en:
Eliseo is 44 and a widower. Since he wife died, he has had to be both a father and a mother for his 3 children whom he treasures. They live in their own house located in the cental jungle of Peru. When he lost his wife, he began drinking a lot without thinking about his children. But he soon realized that they only had him to count on, and he had to move forward. Since then, and for ten years now, he has worked growing plantains, citrus fruits and other crops on his own land as well as on some rented land. His oldest son helps him in the business, and the work has been good for them both. Thanks to the business, he and his family are moving forward together. This is why he wants to plant more crops that can grow in the central jungle, as well as set up a small general store to help his children generate their own income.

This is his first loan with MFP and he is confident that he will make the payments on time, so that he will have access to subsequent loans going forward. He wants to follow the example of other people who have used loans to grow their businesses. The money from the loan will be used to purchase plantains, as well as fertilizer which will help accelerate production.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase plantains to plant as well as fertilizer for the crops

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es:
Elvis tiene 35 años, está casado con Flora, de 29 años, con quien tiene dos hijos: Pamela de 10 y Jeison de 9 años. Toda esta familia vive en una acogedora casa alquilada, ubicada en una apacible zona en lo alto de la sierra del Perú. 

Desde que era muy pequeño sus padres le enseñaron las actividades agrícolas, pero no las practicaba,  hasta hace 10 años atrás que formalmente se dedica a sembrar papa, arveja, zanahoria y flor de gladiolo en los terrenos de sus suegros.
Paralelamente cría algunos animales, como asnos que son indispensables para trasladar sus insumos agrícolas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar las papas, según cuenta porque es como si dibujará líneas profundas al hacer los surcos, además considera rentable su trabajo porque cubre la manutención de toda su familia e incluso ahorrando un poco logró comprar 3 terrenos productivos que sembrará esta campaña por lo que está feliz y deseoso de seguir progresando.
Es así que para el futuro, piensa comprar ganado ovino, porcino y vacuno, además de sembrar en mayor cantidad.
  
Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, sus compañeros de banco comunal conocen de su puntualidad y honestidad, por lo que lo ven como ejemplo para esforzarse cada día más. Con el dinero que ahora solicita tiene pensado comprar una bolsa de semilla de arveja y tres sacos de abono orgánico que esparcirá sobre sus tierras para obtener una cosecha productiva.
texts.en:
Elvis is 35 years old and married to Flora, who is 29. Together they have two children, Pamela, 10 and Jeison, 9. The family lives in a cozy house which they rent, located in the lower sierras of Peru. From the time they were very young, Elvis and Flora learned about agriculture, but they never grew crops for a living until about 10 years ago when they formally began to grow potatoes, carrots and other crops, including flowers, on the land of their ancestors. Together with the crops, they also raise animals such as donkeys, which are indespensable for transporting their products. What they like most about their work is the cultivation of potatoes. Elvis and Flora feel their business is viable, as it allows them to take care of the family, as well as save a little money to buy 3 plots of fertile land which they can plant this season. This is why they are happy and motivated to be growing the business. In the future, they would like to be able to buy sheep, pigs and cows, as well as plant in greater quantity.

This is their 3rd loan with MFP. Their fellow members in the communal bank know Elvis and Flora as being honest and punctual, and an example of hardwork every day. With the new loan they will purchase bags of seeds and sacks of organic fertilizer which they will spread over their land to help with a productive harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bags of seed and sacks of organic fertilizer for a more productive harvest

loans.name: Emergildo

texts.es:
Emergildo tiene 39 años, está casado con Deysi, de 27 años, con quien tiene un pequeño de nombre Nelvis de 3 años. Ellos viven en su humilde casa propia, ubicada en una zona lejana de la sierra peruana.

Él es agricultor desde hace 15 años, pues se dedica a sembrar papa, arveja, pastizales y flor de gladiolo en sus diferentes colores. Sus terrenos de cultivo son propios y cuneta con la ayuda de su esposa en esta labor. También crían asnos para el traslado de sus cargas, y ovejas que vende cuando le hace falta dinero. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es arar las chacras, según refiere porque cada surco es como una medida de lo que obtendrá en la cosecha y sabrá que valió la pena el esfuerzo. Él considera que su actividad es bastante rentable porque le permite sostener  a su familia, invertir en sus terrenos y ahorrar para prevenir cualquier eventualidad.
Por eso, para el futuro anhela ampliar la pequeña tienda que tiene en su casa, sembrar verduras en mayor cantidad y comprar un terreno en la ciudad para construir una casa y su hijo pueda acceder a una buena educación.

Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP con la esperanza de seguir progresando, y tal como fue puntual en sus pagos anteriores está seguro de que ahora también lo será. Además está muy satisfecho con el trabajo que desarrolla dentro de su banco comunal, porque como grupo vienen alcanzando varios logros. Con el dinero que ahora solicita planea comprar 3 bolsas de semilla de arveja y 2 sacos de fertilizantes con los que abonará sus sembríos para asegurar su producción.
texts.en:
Emergildo is 39 years old and is married to Deysi, who is 27. They have a small child named Nelvis, who is 3 years old. They live in their own modest home, located in a distant zone of the Peruvian mountains.

Emergildo has been a farmer for the past 15 years, and he plants potatoes, peas, pasture plants, and different colored gladiolus flowers. He has his own fields and has the help of his wife to take care of them. They also raise donkeys to transport their load, and sheep that he sells when they are low on money. What he likes most about his job is plowing the fields because each furrow is a means by which he will obtain the harvest and will know that it was worth the effort. He considers his business to be rather profitable because it allows him to support his family, invest in his lands, and save for any unexpected event. As a result, in the future he would like to expand the small store he has in his home, plant more vegetables, and purchase land in the city to build a house and so that his son can have a better education.

This is Emergildo’s third loan with MFP and he hopes to continue making process. He is sure that he will be punctual in his loan repayments, just as he has been with his previous repayments. In addition, he is very satisfied with the work done in his communal bank because as a group, they have made several achievements. He plans to purchase 3 bags of pea seeds and 2 sacks of fertilizer with the loan, with which he will fertilize his crops to assure their production.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther es una mujer que ve las adversidades como retos, tiene 35 años y está casada con Nildo, de 37 años. Esta pareja tienen dos hijos; Mayli de 4 y Gabriela de 3 años.

Desde hace 14 años se dedica a  sembrar papa, arveja y flor de gladiolo con la ayuda de su esposo y de su hija mayor. De sus labores agrícolas lo que más le gusta es ver florecer sus cultivos de papa porque el tamaño del tallo le avisa que tan fructífera será su cosecha e incluso el tamaño del tubérculo. Es así que muestra orgullosa sus cultivos en la foto: “la agricultura es bastante rentable porque aparte de cubrir todos los gastos para vivir, deja ganancias considerables que se pueden ahorrar”, manifiesta contenta Esther.
Para el futuro, está pensando sembrar en mayor cantidad porque está segura de poder cuidar adecuadamente sus tierras.

Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y confía en que podrá pagarlo puntualmente, ya que para ella el crédito significa una oportunidad para salir adelante. Además está feliz de trabajar en su banco comunal pues está conformado por personas organizadas y trabajadoras. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará 3 bolsas de semilla de arveja y un saco de abono.
texts.en:
Esther is a woman that sees difficulties as challenges. She is 35 years old and is married to Nildo, who is 37 years old. The couple has two childen: Mayli is 4 and Gabriela is 3 years old.

For the past 14 years, she has planted potatoes, peas, and gladiolus flowers with the help of her husband and their older daughter. What she likes most about farming is seeing her potatoes thrive because the size of the stem tells her how fruit-bearing her crop will be, including the size of the tuber. She shows her pride in her crops in the foto: “farming is rather profitable because aside from covering all of the living expenses, it leaves considerable earnings that can be saved”, Esther says happily. In the future, she is planning to plant greater quantities because she is sure that she will be able to adequately take care of her lands.

This is her second loan with MFP and she trusts that she will be able to make her payments on time, since the loan is an opportunity to succeed for her. In addition, she is happy to work in her communal bank because it consists of organized and hardworking people. With this loan she will purchase 3 bags of pea seeds and a sack of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, de 45 años, es una mujer ejemplar que lucha sola por darles una adecuada calidad de vida sus 3 hijos. Actualmente vive con dos de ellos; Freddy de 23 y Flor de 11 años, su hijo mayor salió de casa en busca de un futuro mejor en la ciudad. 

Ser padre y madre para sus hijos es una difícil tarea que valerosamente afronta Juana desde que su pareja los abandonó. “Para llenar la olla” como ella dice, desde hace 20 años se dedica a siembra de papa, arveja y maíz, también cría ganado vacuno, dos asnos, algunas ovejas y cerdos. Al principio se confundían porque no sabía a quién atender primero, pero ahora las cosas han cambiado, sus hijos están grandes y le ayudan, pues a veces solo se dedica a preparar el almuerzo debido a las dolencias que le aquejan.
Juana se preocupa por tener sus chacras limpias para que sus hijos trabajen adecuadamente, además considera que su actividad es rentable por las satisfacciones y logros que le ha brindado en la vida.       

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y ha notado que su situación económica ha mejorado bastante; además le gusta ser parte de un banco comunal porque sus miembros son bastante activos y solidarios. Juana tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja, dos sacos de fertilizantes y dos botellas de insecticidas para sus cultivos de papa, los que podemos apreciar en la foto.
texts.en:
Juana, age 45, is an exemplary woman who has struggled alone to provide an adequate quality of life for her three children. She currently lives with two of them: Freddy, age 23, and Flor, age 11; her eldest son has left home in search of a better future in the city. Being both father and mother to her children is a difficult task which she has confronted bravely since her partner abandoned the family. "To fill the pot," as she says, she has worked for the past 20 years growing potatoes, peas and corn. She also raises livestock, including cattle, two donkeys, and some sheep and pigs. At the beginning, there was confusion because she did not know what to take care of first, but now things have changed; her children are big and they help her. At times, she only focuses on preparing lunch, due to the pains that affect her. Juana always ensures that her fields are well-maintained so that her children can work effectively. She considers her work to be worthwhile, due to the satisfaction and achievements it has provided her in life. This is Juana's sixth loan with MFP, and she has noticed that her economic situation has improved significantly. She also likes being part of a communal bank, because the members are quite active and show solidarity. Juana is planning to invest the funds she is requesting in a bag of pea seeds, two sacks of fertilizer, and two bottles of insecticide for her potato fields, which we can see in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo Hernán, de 37 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos: Gilber y Melina ambos de 10 años. Ellos viven en su cálida casa propia ubicada en un pueblo tranquilo, pero alejado de la ciudad en la sierra del Perú.

Desde hace 10 años, ella y su esposo se dedican a las labores agrícolas. Siembran papa, arveja, flores de gladiolo, maíz y habas en sus terrenos propios, los cuales compraron desde que inició su matrimonio.
Paralelamente, cría toros que le sirve para arar sus chacras y caballos que le ayudan a trasladar los insumos suficientes para labrar sus terrenos. Lo que más le gusta de sus actividades es sembrar arvejas y flores, porque al comercializarlos le resulta bastante rentable y es menos trabajoso.
Haydee manifiesta: “Con las ganancias que obtengo puedo educar a mis hijos, cubrir las primeras necesidades de mi casa y ahorro para algunas eventualidad que puedan surgir más adelante”. Es por eso que para más adelante, planea comprar más terrenos productivos y sembrar en mayor cantidad.   

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y como desea progresar se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, además esta muy entusiasmada de seguir trabajando con los integrantes de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará dos bolsas de semilla de arveja y varios sacos de abono orgánico para una adecuada producción de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Haydee is 30 years old. She lives with her husband Hernan, who is 37 years old. they have two children: Gilber and Melina, both ten years old. They live in their loving home located in a town in the sierra of Peru that is calm, but far from the city. For 10 years, she and her husband have been doing farmwork. They plant potatoes, peas, gladiola flowers, corn and beans on their own land, which they bought at the beginning of the marriage. At the same time, they raise bulls that they use to till their fields and horses that help to transport the materials needed to work their land. What she likes the most about her activities is planting peas and flowers, because at market they turn out to be very profitable and are the least work. Haydee states: "With the earnings, I get I can educate my children, cover the basic needs of my home and I save for anything that might come up further ahead." This is why, in the future, she plans on buying more productive land and to plant a larger quantity. This is the third loan that she has with MFP and since she wants to get ahead, she is dedicated to making her payments on time. She is also very enthusiastic about continuing to work with the members of her communal bank. With the money that she is asking for now, she will purchase two bags of pea seed and various bags of organic fertilizer for an adequate production from her plantings.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo Leonidas, de 68 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales vive con dos: Romario de 15, Ada de 12 años. Su casa (propia) está localizada en una zona alta y apacible de la sierra del Perú.

Arveja, habas, papa, maíz y flores de gladiolo en sus diferentes colores, son los productos agrícolas que siembra desde hace 35 años. Su esposo menciona que se enamoró de ella por lo trabajadora que era, es por eso que en la actualidad siembran en mayor cantidad con miras a progresar cada vez más.
Lo que más le gusta a Lidia de su labor es cosechar porque ve reflejado su esfuerzo en cada fruto que retira de los terrenos y de los cuales obtendrá ganancias considerables al comercializarlos en el mercado de la ciudad.
Ella considera que la agricultura es rentable porque le permite pagar la educación de sus hijos y porque les da de comer a diario. “En la chacra difícil que mueras de hambre porque puedes vivir aunque sea sancochando papa”, comenta.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete ante su banco comunal a pagar puntualmente como hasta ahora lo hizo porque sabe que su palabra está empeñada. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará ½ bolsa de semilla de arveja, una lata de flor de gladiolo y un saco de abono orgánico que esparcirá en la tierra para evitar que las plagas invadan sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Lidia is 42 years old. She lives with her husband Leonidas, who is 68 years old. She has three children, two of whom she lives with: Romario, 15, and Ada, 12. Her house (her own) is located in a high and peaceful area of the sierra of Peru. Peas, beans, potatoes, corn and various colors of gladiola flowers are the agricultural products that she has been planting for 35 years. Her husband mentions that he fell in love with her because of how hardworking she is. That is why now they are planting in greater quantitites and looking to progress more every day. What Lidia likes the most about her work is harvesting because she sees her work reflected in every product she takes from the earth and from these she will obtain considerable profits when taking them to sell in the market in town. She considers agriculture to be profitable because it allows her to educate her children and it feeds them everyday. "In the field it's hard to starve to death because you can live even if it's by boiling potatoes," she comments. This is the second loan she has had with MFP and she is committed, before her communal bank, to pay on time. Since she has done it so far, they know that her word is good. With the money that she is asking for now she will purchase 1/2 bag of pea seed and a can of gladiola flower and a bag of organic fertilizer which she will spread on the earth to avoid her plantings being invaded by pests.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis tiene 23 años, es un joven emprendedor, muy entusiasta y solitario, vive en una casa alquilada cerca de la carretera de acceso hacia su localidad.
A pesar de que no logró sus estudios superiores de mecánica por falta de dinero, desea salir adelante con la esperanza de progresar. Desde hace un año trabaja como ayudante de mecánico de autos y considera que ya tiene la experiencia necesaria para tener su propio taller, pues es una actividad bastante rentable que le permite vivir sin preocupaciones.

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está contento porque cada vez está más cerca su sueño de tener su propio taller. Por otro lado, le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque sus integrantes son personas organizadas y responsables. Con el dinero que ahora solicita podrá comprar una máquina de soldar para empezar a implementar su propio taller mecánico.
texts.en:
Luis is 23 years old. He is single, and he is an enterprising and very enthusiastic young man. He lives in a rented house near the highway exit for his town. In spite of the fact that he was not able to complete higher education as a mechanic because of a lack of money, he wants to continue moving forward with the hope of making progress. For the past year, he has worked as an assistant to an auto mechanic, and he believes that he now has the necessary experience to open his own workshop. This is well-paid work which permits him to live without worries. This is Luis' sixth loan with MFP, and he has been happy to see that each time he comes closer to his dream of having his own workshop. He also enjoys working with his communal bank, because its members are well-organized and responsible people. With the funds he is currently soliciting, he will be able to buy a welding machine so that he can begin offering services in his own mechanic's workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing machinery for his workshop

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es un humilde trabajador de 42 años, está casado con la siempre alegre Juana, de 30 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos: Luis Alexander de 13 y Luis Samuel de un año.
Su mayor anhelo es poder comprarse un terreno en la ciudad para construir una casa donde pueda instalar una tienda de comestibles, además de incrementar su producción agrícola.
Es por eso que junto a su esposa se esfuerzan a diario en su chacra al sembrar papa, arveja y maíz desde hace 10 años.
Ellos consideran que esta actividad es bastante rentable, pues después de comercializar sus productos en el mercado puede cubrir las primeras necesidades de su familia y permitirle ahorrar.
Sin embargo, lo que no le gusta de su labor es que no puede pasar mucho tiempo con sus hijos, porque debe aprovechar el máximo de tiempo para trabajar en sus chacras; por otro lado, una de las cosas que más le satisface es llevar los productos recién cosechados para que su esposa los cocine y sea su familia los primeros en degustar el sabor de los frutos, recompensa de su dedicación.

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y asegura que está progresando, por lo que desea solicitar más créditos posteriormente. A su vez, desea continuar trabajando con los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes aprecian el trabajo que desempeña. Para asegurar una buena cosecha esta temporada, con el dinero que solicita comprará una bolsa de semilla de arveja, un saco de fertilizante y una botella de insecticida para esparcir sobre sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Luis, 42, is a humble hard-worker. He is married to the always happy Juana, who is 30. They have two children; Luis Alexander is 13, And Luis Samuel is 1. His greatest desire is to buy a piece of land in the city to build a house where he could set up a grocery store. He also wants to increase his agricultural production. That is why he and his wife put forth so much effort everyday. They have been planting potatoes, peas, and corn on their farm for ten years. They consider this activity to be profitable enough. After selling their products in the market they are able to cover the family necessities and save. Nevertheless, what he does not like about his work is not being able to spend much time with his children because he needs to spend as much time as possible working in his fields. On the other hand, one of the things that satisfies him the most is taking his recently harvested products to his wife. She cooks them, and his family is the first to savor the crops. This is recompense for his dedication. This is his sixth loan with MFP. He is sure that he is progressing, and he wants to ask for more loans later. At the same time, he wishes to continue working with the members of his communal bank. They value the work that is done. To assure a good harvest this season, he will use the money he is asking for to buy a bag of pea seeds, a sack of fertilizer, and a bottle of insecticide to apply to his potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth A. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 36 years old. Ruth is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ruth runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Ruth joined HSPFI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Ruth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena tiene 42 años, es madre soltera, su hija se llama Dina y tiene 8 años. Ambas viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en una zona lejana de la selva central del Perú.
Sacar adelante a su hija es la meta principal que desea alcanzar, es por eso que para brindarle una adecuada calidad de vida Magdalena es “mil oficios” y no se cansa porque todo lo hace con amor. 
Desde hace 4 años tiene un negocio de venta de comestibles que instaló en la casa donde vive, por las noches trabaja atendiendo en un grifo a algunas cuadras de sus casa, y los fines de semana se dirige al pueblo donde arrienda algunos terrenos agrícolas y donde desde hace un año también plantó frutos cítricos y plátanos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es el resultado de poder vivir cómodamente con su hija, esa es su mejor recompensa.
Para el futuro, desea comprar más tierras cultivables y un terreno donde construir su casa propia y donde pueda ampliar su negocio.   

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y sabe que pagará puntualmente sus cuotas, agradeciendo la confianza que le brinda la institución. Además está satisfecha con el trabajo que desarrollará dentro de su banco comunal porque sabe que las personas que la integran son responsables. Con el dinero que solicita podrá comprar tres sacos de fertilizante y dos botellas de insecticidas para cuidar sus plantas de las plagas.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 42 years old and a single mother. She has an eight-year-old daughter named Dina. The two of them live in a rented house located in an area far from the central forests of Peru. Her main goal is to provide her daughter with a brighter future. In order to provide her with a decent quality of life, Magdalena works a thousand different jobs and is never tired because she does it all with love. For the past four years, she has had a grocery supply business, which she operates out of her house. At night, she works at a gas station several blocks from her house. On the weekends, she goes to the town where she has several plots of land rented and where, for the past year, she has planted citric fruits and bananas. What she loves most about her work is that in the end, she and her daughter are able to live comfortably. For her, this is the best compensation. In the future, she would like to purchase more cultivable land and a plot, where she could build her own house and also expand her business. This is her first time seeking a loan from MFP and she is certain that she will make punctual payments. She appreciates the faith that the institution has in her. In addition, she is satisfied with how her communal bank is developing because she knows that the people that are forming a part of it are responsible. With the loan that she is applying for, she will be able to buy three sacks of fertilizer and two bottles of insecticide to protect her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
Margot es una mujer bastante trabajadora de 31 años, está casada con Elmer, de 35 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos que son su adoración: Keler de 12 y Ángel de 2 años. Ellos viven en su casa propia que construyeron recientemente.    

Desde hace 13 años se dedica a la agricultura, junto a su esposo siembra arveja, papa, flor de gladiolo (blanco y rojo), en los terrenos que ambos heredaron de sus padres y en los que compraron ellos mismos. También tiene dos asnos que le ayudan a traslada los insumos agrícolas a sus chacras, ya sea en la siembra, cultivo o cosecha. Margot considera que su trabajo es bastante rentable porque con lo que pudo ahorrar compró un vehículo que le sirve para trasladar sus cosechas al mercado. “Tanto la arveja como la papa son una buena inversión porque en sus temporadas se venden a muy buenos precios”, menciona.

Este es la tercera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP y se compromete a seguir siendo puntual y responsable en cada pago, tal como se lo enseñan las personas de su banco comunal donde le gusta trabajar. Muy segura de sí, invertirá el dinero que ahora solicita en la compra de dos bolsas de semilla de arveja que le permitirá aprovechar la campaña de siembra que se avecina.
texts.en:
Margot is 31 years old and a very hard-working woman. She is married to Elmer, whom is 35 years old, and with whom she has two children that she adores: a twelve-year-old named Keler and a two-year-old named Angel. They all live in their own house, which they recently built. For the past thirteen years, she has dedicated herself to agriculture, alongside with her husband, planting peas, potatoes, and gladiolus flowers (white and red) on the plots that they both inherited from their parents, who had purchased them themselves. She also has two donkeys that help her carry her agricultural supplies to her small farm, be it the sowing, cultivating, or harvest season. Margot considers her work to be quite profitable because with what she was able to save, she was able to buy a vehicle to transport her crops to the market. “Peas and potatoes are both equally good investments because when they are in season, they both sell at very good prices,” she mentions. This is the third time that she is seeking a loan from MFP and she continues to promise to be responsible and make punctual payments, just like how the people from her communal bank, where she likes to work, taught her. She is fairly certain that she will use this money to buy two sacks of pea seeds that will allow her to take advantage of the sowing season that is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 49 años, está felizmente casada con José Antonio, de 55 años, con quien vive en su casa propia construida a base de madera ubicada en la central selva del Perú.

Desde hace 8 años, junto a su esposo se dedican al cultivo de plátanos, frutos cítricos y café. Lo que más le gusta es cosechar sus productos, los que después traslada hacia el mercado de su ciudad o los vende a los comerciantes mayoristas desde sus chacras.
Martha está contenta con las buenas ganancias que obtiene porque cosecha varias veces sus frutos de una sola siembra.
Sus planes a futuro son de comprar más terrenos productivos para asegurarse una vida tranquila en adelante. 

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y como sabe que progresará se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Además, está muy entusiasmada de trabajar en su banco comunal porque conoce a las personas que lo conforman. Con el dinero que solicita comprará varias plantas de plátano para esta temporada de invierno.
texts.en:
Martha is 49 years old and is happily married to Jose Antonio, whom is 55 years old and with whom she lives with in their wooden-built home, located in the central forest of Peru. For the past eight years, alongside her husband, they have dedicated themselves to the cultivation of bananas, citric fruits, and coffee. What she loves most is harvesting her crops, which she later transports to the city market or she sells to wholesale merchants. Martha is content with how much she earns because she harvests several fruits from a single seed. Her future plans are to purchase more lucrative plots of land in order to ensure a safe and secure life ahead. This is her first time seeking a loan from MFP, and knowing that she will make progress, she promises to make punctual payments. In addition, she is very enthusiastic about working within her communal bank because she knows the people that form a part of it. With the money that she is applying for, she will purchase various banana plants for the upcoming winter season.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase banana plants.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam es una joven alegre y amorosa de 21 años, se acaba de casar con Gabriel, de 27 años, ambos tienen un hijo de un año quien es el motor que los empuja a salir adelante. Ellos viven en una casa alquila da en una zona de la sierra central del Perú.

Todos los días, desde muy temprano, ella es la encargada de preparar los alimentos que llevará a los terrenos donde trabaja al lado de su esposo. Pese a dedicarse a la agricultura diariamente, no se cansa, pues tiene12 años sembrando papa, arveja y maíz, productos bastante solicitados en el mercado, por lo que le es rentable comercializarlos rápidamente y a buenos precio.
Además, las ganancias obtenidas le permiten ahorrar, pues más adelante desea instalar una tienda de comestibles a pocos metros del lugar donde vive, en un espacio que alquilará en busca de progreso. 

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y sabe que cada crédito le ayuda a mejorar su situación económica, también dice que trabajar con su banco comunal le gusta y le ayuda mucho. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería (productos de primera necesidad) para implementar e inaugurar su tienda.
texts.en:
Miriam is a cheerful and loving young woman who is 21 years old, and is about to marry Gabriel, 27. Together they have a 1 year-old son , and he is the engine that drives them to succeed. They live in a rented house in a neighborhood in the central highlands of Peru. Every day, from very early in the morning, she is in charge of preparing food that she will take to the fields where she works along with her husband. In spite of working daily in agriculture, she does not tire. She has been cultivating potatoes, peas and corn for 12 years. There is substantial demand for these products in the market, so it is profitable to sell them quickly and at a good price. In addition, the earnings she obtains allow her to save, because later on she would like to establish a grocery store a few yards from the place that she lives, in a space that she will rent in search of progress. This is the 6th loan that she has taken with MFP, and she knows that every loan helps her to improve her economic situation. In addition, she says that it has been very helpful to her to work with her communal bank, which she likes very much. The money that she requests now will be used to purchase merchandise (basic necessities) to set up and start up her store.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to set up her new grocery store

loans.name: Nerida

texts.es:
Nerida es una mujer muy alegre de 33 años, vive con su esposo Manuel, de 35 años, y con sus  2 hijos: Karina de 14 y Arnol de 6 años. Ellos viven en su casa propia en un lejano pueblo de la sierra del Perú.

Desde hace 15 años, junto a su esposo se dedica a sembrar maíz, papa, arveja, habas y flores de gladiolo en sus terrenos propios y en otros arrendados.  A Nerida le gusta toda la actividad agrícola, pues considera que es bastante rentable ya que le permite vivir cómodamente sin preocupaciones. Es por eso que para el futuro desea comprar más terrenos agrícolas y sembrar en mayor cantidad, también quiere implementar una tienda de comestibles en la ciudad, porque su hija pasará a la secundaria y necesitará estar donde hay colegios de este nivel académico para continuar con sus estudios.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a pagar puntualmente cada cuota; a su vez, está contenta de trabajar con los integrantes de su banco comunal porque son sus vecinos y siempre están pendientes de ella.  Nerida tiene pensado invertir el dinero que ahora solicita en la compra de dos sacos de abono y dos bolsas de semilla de arveja.
texts.en:
Nerida is a very cheerful 33-year-old woman, who lives with her husband Manuel, age 35, and their 2 children: Karina, age 14, and Arnol, age 6. They live in their own home in an isolated village in the Peruvian highlands. For the past 15 years, Nerida has worked as a farmer, together with her husband, growing corn, potatoes, peas, beans and gladiolus flowers on their own lands and on rented fields. Nerida enjoys all of her agricultural work; she considers it very worthwhile, since it lets her live comfortably and without worries. For this reason, in the future she wants to buy more agricultural land and plant greater quantities of crops. She would also like to open a food store in the city, because her daughter will be starting secondary school, and she will need to be where there are schools at this academic level to continue her studies. This is Nerida's third loan with MFP, and she is committed to making every payment on time. She enjoys working with the members of her communal bank, because they are her neighbors and they are always looking out for her. Nerida is planning to invest the funds she is currently requesting to purchase two sacks of fertilizer and two bags of pea seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Qasr-E- Kabul Number 2 Group

texts.en:
Bibi Sanam is the group leader of Qasr-e- Kabul Number 2 group. There are four members in this group. Bibi Sanam is a married woman with three children. She wants to use her loan for purchasing a new sewing machine for her tailoring business.

Bibi Sadaf wants to take a loan for her husband’s business, which is a battery-charging shop. He wants to buy necessary materials for his business. 

Norya wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of selling vegetables from a cart. He needs money to buy a new shop for the business. 

Also, Mansor wants to take a loan for his business. He has a bicycle-repair shop. He is confident that after the loan he will be able to work in a better way and will support all his family members.

They requested a group loan of 56000 Afghani. They would like to mention the effectiveness of the Kiva process and its effect on their business progress.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for their businesses

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
Nimia tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo Raúl de también 27 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Anthony de 7 y Farid de 1 año; esta familia vive en su casa propia ubicada en una lejana zona de la sierra del Perú.

Papa, maíz, arveja y flores de gladiolo, son los productos agrícolas que siembra desde hace 7 años con la ayuda de su esposo. Sus terrenos de cultivo son propios y también arrienda otros para incrementar su producción. Cuando cosecha las arvejas y las flores las debe seleccionar por su calidad y tamaño, pero a la vez es sencillo su proceso, pues después de sembrar sólo abona para evitar que sean invadidos por las plagas y al comercializarlas le generan ingresos económicos considerables.
Por eso que para el futuro, Nimia tiene pensado comprar más terrenos que le permitan dejar de lado las chacras arrendadas y así sembrar en mayor cantidad y obtener más ganancias que le permitan salir adelante.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy feliz porque le gusta trabajar con los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes comparten el mismo anhelo de superación. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará dos bolsas de semilla de arveja, pues desea aprovechar esta campaña de siembra. Además tiene pensado hacer alcanzar el dinero para comprar un saco de fertilizante y una botella de insecticida.
texts.en:
Nimia, 27, lives with her husband Raul, who is also 27 years old. They have 2 children together: Anthony, who is 7, and Farid, who is 1. This family lives in their own home located in a remote area in the Peruvian highlands. Potatoes, corn, peas and gladiolus flowers are the agricultural products that she has been cultivating for 7 years, with the help of her husband. They own the land that they cultivate, and they also rent other lands to increase their production. When she harvests the peas and flowers she must select them for their quality and size, but this is a simple process. After the harvest she must fertilize with compost to avoid being invaded by pests and to generate the most income when the products are brought to market. In the future, Nimia is thinking of buying more land so that she could avoid having to rent land. This way she could cultivate in larger quantities to obtain higher earnings to help her get ahead. This is her second loan with MFP, and she is very happy because she likes to work with the other members of her communal bank, who share her desire to succeed. With the money that she now requests she will buy 2 sacks of pea seeds, so that she can take advantage of the upcoming planting season. In addition, she will use the money to buy a sack of fertilizer and a bottle of insecticide.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: top buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida R. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old. Zenaida is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Zenaida runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Zenaida has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Zenaida joined HSPFI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Zenaida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora tiene 42 años, recientemente se casó con Percy, de 30 años, y por el momento viven en la casa de los padres de ella.
Desde hace 5 años decidió encargar se de las siembras de sus padres, porque ellos ya no podías hacerlo. Desde entonces empezó a sembrar arveja, papa, maíz y flores; paralelamente también cría ovejas y ganado vacuno. Afortunadamente, ahora cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo, y a ambos les apasiona sembrar flores porque disfrutan de su cultivo, cuidado y cosecha; además considera que sus actividades son rentables porque le ayudan a sostener a su familia y a ahorrar para más adelante poder comprar una casa, más terrenos agrícolas y poder sembrar en mayor cantidad.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y como la primera vez, se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas para no hacer quedar mal a su banco comunal, pues desea acceder a más créditos que le permiten salir a delante. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abono orgánico, fertilizantes y una bolsa de semillas de arveja.
texts.en:
Nora is 42 years old and recently married to Percy, who is 30. For the moment they are living in the home of Nora's parents. Five years ago Nora decided to take over charge of her parents agriculture business, because they were no longer able to manage. Since then, she began to grow potatoes, corn, flowers and other crops. In parallel, she also raises sheep and cows. Fortunately, she can now count on the help of her husband, and they are both passionate about cultivating flowers. They feel they have a viable business because it enables them to support their family, as well as save so that they can buy their own house, buy more land to farm and plant in greater quantities.

This is the second loan with MFP, and just like the first time, Nora has committed to make punctual payments to maintain her good standing with the communal bank. She would like to be able to secure more loans in the future. This loan will be used to purchase organic fertilizer as well as bags of more seeds to plant.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bags of seeds to plant and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 34 años, es una mujer simpática y optimista, está casada con Olo, de 43 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos: Yessenia de 12 y Jonathan de 4 años. Esta hermosa familia vive en una humilde y acogedora casa que es propia.

Pese a la discapacidad que tiene en las piernas no se amilana, ni se asusta ante los trabajos pesados que desarrolla en la chacra, pues cuando la excluyen se siente “inútil”.
Por eso ayuda de su esposo y de su hija mayor, desde hace 14 años, a la crianza de sus asnos y a la siembra de papa y arveja, productos con bastante demanda en el mercado
Sus ganas de trabajar son envidiables, sólo basta escucharla para sentir que todo es posible; lo que más le gusta de vivir en la sierra y cuidar de las calabazas y cuando están maduras prepara unos deliciosos dulces. Rosa cuenta que sus hijos son bastante estudiosos, por eso le pide fuerzas al Divino para que continué trabajando y puedan seguir pagando sus estudios.
Para el futuro, planea sembrar en mayor cantidad y con las ganancias que obtenga comprar una casa en la ciudad para instalar una tienda de comestibles.

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está gustosa de trabajar en su banco comunal porque se siente en familia y aprende nuevas lecciones en cada reunión. Rosa tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de algunos sacos de abono y botellas de insecticidas para proteger de las plagas sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Rosa is 34 years old and is a kind and optimistic person. She is married to Olo, 43 years old, and together they have two children, Yessenia, who is 12, and Jonathan, who is 4. This beautiful family lives in a humble and cozy home which they own. Rosa has a disability in her legs, but this does not discourage her, nor is she afraid of the hard work that comes with farming. When she can't work she feels useless. So her husband, and her oldest daughter help her with her business raising donkeys and cultivating potatoes and other crops which are in high demand. The income she generates is enviable, and you only have to listen to her to feel that anything is possible.

What she likes most about living in the sierras and cultivating squash is that when they are ripe, she can prepare delicious sweets. Rosa says that her children are good students, so she prays for strength to continue working so that she can pay for their education. In the future, she plans to plant in greater quantity, and with the income she would like buy a house in the city and set up a small general store.

This is the 6th loan with MFP. Rosa likes working with the communal bank because it feels like a family, and she learns new things in every meeting. This loan will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizer and bottles of insecticide to protect the potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide to protect her potato crops

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio es un hombre muy trabajador de 50 años, vive con su esposa Gloria, de 40 años, y con su  última hija, Jacqueline de 11 años; sus 3 hijos mayores están en la capital (Lima) estudiando una carrera profesional. 

Desde muy joven la pasión por arreglar las cosas hicieron que la electrónica sea su oficio, por lo que emocionado Sergio dice: “tengo 35 años dedicándome a este trabajo, con el cual pago los estudios de mis hijos, pude construir mi casa y me hice de clientes que me estiman mucho que es lo más gratificante para mí”. Por nada del mundo quiere abandonar su trabajo, es por eso que para el futuro quiere abrir una sucursal de su negocio con el nombre “Electrónica Fernández II”, pues dice que toda la población sabrá de quién se trata. Por otro lado, también desea construir otra casa para que sus hijos tengan independencia.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y asegura que pagará responsable y puntualmente cada cuota, además trabajará activamente en su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará algunos repuestos para su taller; tale como componentes electrónicos y artefactos usados.
texts.en:
Sergio is a hardworking man of 50. He lives with his wife Gloria, 40, and their youngest daughter Jacqueline who is 11 years old. They have 3 grown children who are studying in the capital, Lima.

From the time he was very young, Sergio had a passion for fixing things, making it natural that he would work in electronics. Sergio says, emotionally, "I have 35 years dedicated to this work, and it has allowed me to pay for the education of my children, and build my house, and given me clients who hold me in high esteem which is the most gratifying for me". There is nothing in the world that would make him want to leave his work. In the future he wants to open a branch called Electronica F. II. He would also like to build another house so that his children will have some independence. This is the first loan with MFP, and he is sure he can make each payment on time. He also plans to work actively in the communal bank. This loan will be used to purchase supplies for his shop such as electronic components and used parts.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies for his shop such as electronic components and used parts

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia es una mujer muy alegre de 40 años, vive felizmente casada con Medardo, de 39 años, y con uno de sus dos hijos, Kenyo de 14 años, pues el mayor viajó a la capital en busca de adquirir una educación superior. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en lo alto de un pueblo de la sierra del Perú. 

Desde que tenía 20 años se viene dedicando a la agricultura. Actualmente siembra papa, arveja, maíz y habas en los terrenos que compró después de varios años de trabajo. En las actividades trabaja junto a su esposo, quien es el encargado de arar las chacras. Lo que más le gusta a Teodosia es sembrar, porque le gusta deslizar por sus manos la semilla antes de entregarla a la tierra para su germinación y ver crecer sus plantas poco a poco.
Una vez cosechado sus productos los comercializa de acuerdo a la oferta y la demanda en el mercado de su localidad. 
Para el futuro desea sembrar en mayor cantidad, sobre todo arveja porque es el producto de menor inversión.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y manifiesta que desde su primer crédito ha tenido un notable progreso económico, por eso continuará pagando responsablemente sus cuotas para acceder a otros créditos. A su vez, le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque disfruta mucho las diferentes actividades que realizan. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará dos bolsas de semilla de arveja, dos sacos de abono orgánico (estiércol de animal procesado como guano) y dos botellas de insecticidas que libren sus terrenos de las plagas.
texts.en:
Teodosia is a cheerful, 40 year-old woman who lives happily married with her husband, Medardo, who is 39, and one of their children, Kenyo, who is 14. Their older child went to the capital looking to obtain a higher education. They live in their own house which is located in a town in the highlands of Peru. She has been working in agriculture for 20 years. Currently she is cultivating potatoes, peas, corn and beans on lands that she bought after various years of working. She works along with her husband, who is in charge of plowing the fields. What Teodosia likes most is to plant, because she likes to feel the seeds slip from her hand before they are placed in the earth to germinate, and to see the plants grow little by little. In the future she would like to plant in greater quantities, mostly peas, because this product requires the smallest investment. This is her third loan with MFP, and she expresses that since her first loan she has made notable economic progress. For this reason she will continue to be responsible with her payments so that she can continue to access other loans. For her part, she likes to work with her communal bank because she enjoys the different activities that they carry out. With the money that she requests now she will buy 2 sacks of pea seeds, 2 sacks of organic fertilizer (processed animal manure), and 2 bottles of insecticides to free her lands of pests.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy seeds, organic fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Zakrya Raysa Group

texts.en:
This is the Zakrya Raysa group. The group leader is Mena Gull, who is married with five children, three sons and two daughters. His youngest son is a first-year college student and the others are students at school.She and her family live in 11th district of Kabul Afghanitan. Sh takes this loan for her husband who is a mechanic. He has a workshop in the city of Kabul where he repairs cars. He wants to expand his business and to support his family in a better way.By the loan he would like to purcahse parts of the car which are not avialable in his workshop.He would like to expand his business as well. 
Mena Gull is confident that will do the repayments on time and hope that her husband will expand his business soon.

loans.use: purchasing parts of the car

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo es un carismático hombre de 30 años, vive con sus padres; Alejo de 64 y Lucila de 65 años. Ellos viven en una acogedora casa ubicada en la sierra peruana.
Desde hace 4 años el amor que siente por las tierras que lo vieron nacer lo impulsaron a dedicarse a la agricultura, y gracias, a la siembra papa, arveja y flores de gladiolo ha podido terminar de estudiar una carrera profesional y cubrir los gastos de sus padres.
La ventaja es que ha podido conocer a comerciantes mayoristas que le pagan lo justo por sus productos, también refiere que de la agricultura le gusta todo excepto que como está sólo debe gastar en la contratación de operarios. Por eso dentro de sus planes futuros quiere unir su vida a alguien que desee trabajar sembrando en mayor cantidad. Asimismo, como estudió farmacéutica desea tener una farmacia, para ayudar a sus vecinos, ya que le gusta ser solidario.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está seguro que pagará puntualmente sus cuotas. Además está feliz de trabajar con las personas de su banco comunal a quienes aprecia porque prácticamente creció con ellos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará una bolsa de semilla de arveja para aprovechar la temporada de siembra.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is a charismatic 30-year-old man. He lives with his parents: Alejo, age 64, and Lucila, age 65. They live in a cozy home in the Peruvian mountain range. The love that he feels for the land of his birth compelled him into agriculture 4 years ago, and thanks to the sowing of potatoes, peas, and gladiolas, he has been able to finish his professional studies and meet his parents' expenses. One advantage of his work is being able to meet wholesalers who pay him fairly for his products. He also likes everything about agriculture except for having to pay for contracted workers. Because of this, his future plans include joining with someone who wants to work at large-scale planting. Additionally, as he studied pharmacology he wants to have a pharmacy in order to help his neighbors since he enjoys being supportive. This is his second loan through MFP, and he is positive that he will make his repayments on time. Also, he appreciates and is happy working with the people in his community bank because he has practically grown up with them. With the money that he is now requesting, he plans to buy a bag of pea seeds so he can take advantage of the planting season.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic A. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old. Marivic is single and has one infant child. To make a living, Marivic owns & operates a business selling electronic load (phone use cards) and some cell phone accessories. At the same time, Marivic has a small sari-sari store where she sells different goods in the local community. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marivic joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marivic from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 47 años, vive con su pareja, Antonio de 56 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales sólo vive con uno, Edwar de 20 años. La casa es habitan es propia y está ubicada en un lugar apacible de la sierra del peruana.

Desde hace 30 años se dedica a la siembra de arveja, papa, flor de gladiolo, habas y maíz. Paralelamente cría dos caballos y varios asnos que le ayudan a trasladar sus insumos agrícolas hasta su chacra diariamente. A Yolanda le gusta sembrar la arveja y flor de gladiolos porque son los productos que tienen mayor demanda en el mercado y son bastante rentables.
“Dedicándome a la agricultura he podido cubrir la educación de mis hijos, construir mi casa y ahora estoy ahorrando, tal vez para comprarme un carro que transporte mis cosechas”, refiere.
Para el futuro desea incrementar su producción de arveja y instalar una tienda de comestibles en su vivienda.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y ante los integrantes de su banco comunal se compromete a pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas, porque al igual que ellos desea salir adelante. Por ello, invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de dos botellas de insecticidas y pesticidas, además de un saco de abono y pagará a algunas personas para fumigar sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 47 years old and lives with her partner, Antonio who is 56. They have 3 children, one of whom, Edwar who is 20, lives with them. They live in their own house, which is located in a peaceful area of the Peruvian sierra. For the past 30 years, Yolanda has worked planting peas, potatoes, gladiolus flowers, beans and corn. At the same time she has raised two horses and several donkeys that have helped her daily to move the crops around the farm. Yolanda likes to plant peas and gladiolus flowers because they are products that have the most demand in the market and are very profitable. "Dedicating myself to farming has allowed me to pay for my children's education, build my house and now I am saving, perhaps to buy a car to transport my harvest," she says. For the future she wants to increase her pea production and set up a grocery store in her house. This is Yolanda's first loan with MFP and before the members of her communal bank she promises to punctually pay her fees, because, like the others, she wants to get ahead in life. She will invest the money she is requesting in buying two bottles of insecticide and pesticide as well as a bag of fertilizer and will pay for some people to fumigate her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace S. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old. Grace is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Grace owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells electronic load (phone use cards) in the local community. Grace has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Mallay Nawed Group

texts.en:
Mallay is the group leader of Mallay Nawed group. There are three members in this group. Mallay is a married woman with three children. She lives in Kabul city and she wants to take a loan for her tailoring business in order to buy a new sewing machine because she had lots of problems with the old one.

Nabellah wants to take a loan for her husband's business. He has a general store. With the loan, he would buy more materials to expand his business. 

Nawed wants to take a loan for his business of selling gas. He wants to buy four new balloons for his shop. 

They requested a group loan of 30,000 Afghani. They all are happy and would like to extend their gratitude to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with a teenage daughter, Alla. She lives in Gladkovka, in the Kherson region. 

Tatyana owns a greenhouse and grows early spring vegetables, such as tomatoes, radishes and greens. She has been in this business for 25 years and has gained much experience. Tatyana has 12,000 Grivnyas invested in this business. 

Tatyana is seeking an 8,000 Grivnya loan to purchase seeds and polyethylene film to refurbish her greenhouse. She wants to make sure her greenhouse is well-equipped and ready for another farm season. Tatyana is used to hard work and willing to invest  energy and effort in her venture to see it flourish.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and polyethylene film to repair her greenhouse

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan is married with a 12-year-old son. He lives in Ivano-Frankivsk. Ruslan runs his retail sale business in one of the local markets called “Skhidnyi” (“Eastern”), where he sells groceries. Ruslan started this business only a year ago. However, he’s already making 5,000 Grivnyas in profit each month.   

Ruslan is seeking a 10,000 Grivnya loan to purchase 200 kilograms of smoked fish. He is an experienced entrepreneur. He has been self-employed for 18 years and has had  transportation services and construction businesses as well as retail sales. The venture Ruslan is running now is the main source of income for his family.

loans.use: To purchase smoked fish

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with a 7-year-old son. She lives in Stryi, where she runs a souvenir sales business.  She has another sales location in the town of Truskavets, a popular resort in the Carpathian mountains. Olga sells paintings, woodcrafts and other retail souvenir items. She had experience working as a salesperson before she launched her own business. Olga has been in this trade for 3 years. Currently, she has about 10,000 Grivnyas worth of merchandise.
