texts.en: Khaled, a 36-year-old married man with one child, has owned a jewelry shop in his town since 1989. He is well-known in the whole region after this long experience. Specializing in selling and repairing jewelry, to satisfy market demand Khaled is requesting a loan of $700 to buy a laptop to prepare jewelry designs.

loans.use: To buy a laptop

loans.name: Marcia Pastora

texts.es: Marcia Pastora de 44 años de edad es soltera, tiene 1 hijo de nombre Edwin de 22 años de edad el cual estudia, cuenta con el apoyo de su compañero de vida quien asume los gastos del hogar. Marcia trabaja para el MINED desde hace 23 años como maestra de primaria, muy temprano sale a la escuelita ubicada carretera a Rama para impartir el pan de la enseñanza a los niños de esa comunidad.  Esta solicitando su 7mo credito a AFODENIC esperando ser beneficiada con el fondo kiva para mejorar su vivienda levantando 3 paredes y terminar un cuarto del que ya tiene los arranques, su casita es de proyecto y necesita este cuarto para mayor espacio y comodidad de su familia. Afirma que le gusta la atencion que le brindan y que gracias a estos creditos ha mejorado las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Marcia Pastora is 44 years old. She is single and has a son named Edwin who is 22 and in school. She has the support of her life partner, who helps cover the household expenses. Marcia has worked for the Ministry of Education for 23 years as an elementary school teacher. She leaves home early in the morning for the little school located on the road to Rama, where she nourishes the children of the community with her teaching. She is asking for a 7th loan with AFODENIC, hoping to benefit from Kiva funding in order to improve her home. She would like to put up three walls and finish a room that has already been started. Her house is part of a subsidized construction project and she needs this room to give her family more space and comfort. She is thankful for the help given by AFODENIC and says that thanks to these loans she has improved her family's living conditions

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room.

loans.name: Teresa Del Socorro

texts.es: Teresa de 38 años de edad es soltera, tiene 2 hijos: Tania de 15 años en 4to año de secundaria y Fernando de 9 años en 3er grado de primaria. Teresa trabaja como maestra desde hace 18 años en la Escuela Enrique Tierno Galvan. Esta solicitando su 7mo credito para mejorar su vivienda construyendo un porche con su techo, ya cuenta con una parte de los materiales .  Teresa expresa que gracias a los creditos financiados por AFODENIC ha logrado mejorar su casa poniendole ceramica a la sala,  y espera ser beneficiada con el fondo kiva y lograr la realizacion de este proyecto.
texts.en:
Teresa is 38 years old and single. She has two children: Tania, 15, is in her 4th year of high school and Fernando, 9, is in 3rd grade. Teresa has been working for 18 years as a teacher at a school called Enrique Tierno Galvan. She is asking for her 7th loan in order to improve her house by building a covered porch. She already has some of the materials she needs. Teresa says that thanks to the loans already financed by AFODENIC she has been able to improve her house by laying tiles in the main room. She hopes that with funding from Kiva she will be able to finish this project.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a porch

loans.name: Ileana Del Socorro

texts.es: Ileana de 46 años de edad es soltera, tiene 4 hijos mayores, su hijo menor, Robin de 22 años vive con ella, actualmente doña Ileana solo tiene a cargo a su pequeño nieto Melsin de 12 añitos estudiando el 1er año de secundaria. Trabaja para el MINED en la Escuela Enrique Tierno Galvan desde hace 23 años como maestra de primaria. Esta solicitando su 6to cre4dito a AFODENIC para construir un cuarto en su casa y asi contar con mejores condiciones y comodidad ya que su casa es de proyecto y es muy pequeña.  Espera lograr contar con el apoyo de kiva para la realizacion de este pequeño proyecto.
texts.en:
Ileana is 46 years old and is single. She has 4 grown children. Her youngest son Robin, who is 22, lives with her. Currently, Ileana is also caring for her 12 year old grandson Melsin, who is in the first year of high school. Ileana has worked for the Ministry of Education as an elementary school teacher in the Enrique Tierno Galvan School for 23 years. She is asking for a 6th loan from AFODENIC to add a room to her house. This will improve her living conditions and her level of comfort because her house is part of a subsidized construction project and is very small. She hopes to find support through Kiva to finish this small project.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room.

loans.name: Zenayda

texts.es: Zenayda de 46 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos: Hector de 27 años que trabaja en el EMPA, alexander de 25 años trabaja en la UNAN, ambos le apoyan con los gastos del hogar; y el menor Jader de 8 añitos que estudia la primaria. Zenayda trabaja para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 22 años como responsable del cementerio de Juigalpa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja en el hospital como camillero que asume los gastos del hogar, esta solicitando su 9no credito y espera continuar contando con el apoyo de kiva y poder construir un cuarto para uno de sus hijos que se acaba de casar y tiene un bebito de meses y desea darle privacidad a la familia que acaba de formar. Con los creditos anteriores ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia ya que con el ultimo logro cambiar el techo y levantar paredes de su cocina. Su mayor sueño es seguir mejorando su casa para brindarle comodidad a su familia puesto que es el patrimonio que les dejara.
texts.en:
Zenayda, 46, has three children: Hector, 27, who works for EMPA, Alexander, 25, who works at UNAN, both of whom contribute to household expenses, and Jader, 8, who is in elementary school. Zenayda has worked for Juigalpa's mayor's office for the last 22 years as caretaker at Juigalpa's municipal cemetery. Her husband, who is employed as a stretcher-bearer at a hospital, is responsible for household expenses. She is asking for her 9th loan and hopes to continue to have Kiva's support to build a bedroom for one of her sons, who has recently married and has a baby that is under a year old; she would like to provide him with more parivacy for the family he has just formed. Her previous loans allowed her to improve her family's living conditions in that she used the last one to reroof the house and to build the walls for her kitchen. Her greatest wish it to continue to improve her home so that her family will have more comfort since this is the main asset she plans to leave them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Fulgencio

texts.es: Fulgencio es casado, tiene una hija de 18 años de edad de nombre Escarleth, la que habita en casa de su papá junto a su familia, conformada por su esposo y una bebita de 2 añitos, don Fulgencio labora en la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como operario de limpieza, esta solicitando su 1er credito a AFODENIC y espera contar con el apoyo de Kiva  para poder completar la construccion de un cuarto de 4 x 3 mts cuadrados en su casa y asi mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Expresa que cuando termine de cancelar este credito solicitara otro para continuar mejorando su casa.
texts.en:
Fulgencio is married and has an 18-year-old daughter, Escarleth. Escarleth and her family, composed of her husband and 2-year-old daughter, live with her parents. Fulgencio is employed by Juigalpa's mayor's office as a maintenance man. He is requesting his first loan from AFODENIC and hopes to have Kiva's support to finish building a 4x3 meter room in his house to improve his family's living conditions. He states that he will request an additional loan to continue improving his house when he finishes paying back this onel.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Reinario

texts.es:
Reinario es un padre de familia de 30 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de tres y seis años de edad en el sector Macabi bajo del distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace cinco años trabaja como obrero agrícola en los campos de cultivo de la zona. Usualmente trabaja en la cosecha de espárragos. El nos comenta que esta actividad es la única fuente de ingreso económico con la que cuenta su familia por lo que todos los dias se esfuerza al máximo por seguir adelante.

Por otro lado apoya la economía de su hogar con el negocio de crianza y venta de animales, el cría cerdos y vacas para luego venderlos a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona en donde vive.

Reinario de encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternartiva un crédito de  400 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en hacer mejoras en su vivienda. Específicamente en el techo, ya que la temporada de lluvias de verano se acerca y su casa no esta preparada para soportar los fenómenos climaticos propios de esta época del año.

Reinario es un padre de familia honrado y trabajador. Esta es la tercera vez que trabaja con nuestra Institución y en todas ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Reinario, 30, lives with his wife and two children, 3 and 6 years of age, in the Macabi sector of Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, which is three hours away from the city of Chiclayo. For the last 5 years he has worked as a field hand in the area's farming lands. He usually works on asparagus crops. He tells us that this is the only source of income for his family so he works very hard every day in order to get ahead. On the other hand, he augments his family income raising animals; he raises pigs and cows for subsequent sale to merchants that frequent the area where he lives. Reinario is asking Edpyme Alternativa for 400 new soles to be used in home improvement. Specifically, he needs to repair the roof because the Summer rainy season is approaching and his house isn't prepared to withstand the climactic phenomena typical this time of year. Reinario is an honest, hard-working father. This is the third time he has collaborated with our institution and has always shown himself to be puntual and responsible with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay roof repair costs.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: Don Martin de 54 años de edad es soltero, tiene 4 hijos: Ana Gabriela de 14 años, un par de gemelos de 13 años Paulino y Martin y el menor Darling de 12 años, todos estudiando; Martin trabaja para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 20 años como operario de limpieza, esta solicitando su 1er credito para mejorar su casa cambiando el techo que se encuentra en mal estado, poniendo perlines para que sean mas duraderos. Espera lograr con el apoyo de kiva para la realizacion de este proyecto, ya que desea llevarlo a cabo antes que llegue el invierno.
texts.en:
Martin, 54, is single and has four children: Ana Gabriela, 14, a pair of 13-year-old twins, Paulino and Martin, and the youngest, Darling, 12. All the children are in school. Martin has worked as a maintenance man for the Juigalpa's Mayor's office for the last 20 years. He is requesting his first loan to replace the roof on his house because it is in poor condition. He wants to install metal sheeting that is longer-lasting. He hopes to have Kiva's support to complete this project because he wants to finish it before Winter arrives.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a new roof.

loans.name: Kagarama Group, Ntungamo

texts.en: Alaisa N. is the leader of her lending group in Ntungamo. A hard-working, focused and determined lady who is the married mother of four children aged 20 to 7 years, all in school, Alaisa has sold second-hand clothes for five years. She is able to make 70,000/= as weekly profits although her business is faced with challenges including the poor seasons, high transport costs and the accidents that occur as traders move from one market to another almost every day. She ensures that she has a variety of clothes for sale and hopes for more business expansion plus the ability to educate her children and accumulate assets. Alaisa needs a loan to be able to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.use: Buying more clothes for resale.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María Elena es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su pequeña hija de tres años de edad en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el sector Macabi Bajo del distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace siete años ha instalado en un ambiente de la casa en donde vive una bodega en la que ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de abarrotes, verduras, carnes y bebidas. Este negocio nació de la nacesidad de ayudar a solventar los gastos del hogar de sus padres mientras era soltera, y ahora le ayuda también a apoyar al sustento económico de su familia.

El negocio goza de buena acogida ya que ella ofrece un buen trato a sus clientes y los productos que vende son de buena calidad. Además ella complementa su negocio con la venta de raspadilla (helado hecho a base de hielo con saborizantes naturales) durante la temporada de verano.

María Elena desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de bebidas gaseosas. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más bebidas para su negocio y de un andamio para mostrarlas.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora. Su más grande anhelo es ampliar su negocio para poder comprarse una casa propia. Esta es la segunda vez que trabaja con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente responsable y puntual al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
María Elena, 30, lives with her husband and 3-year-old daughter in her parents' home, located in Macabi Bajo sector, Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, which is three hours away from the city of Chiclayo. For the last 7 years she has operated a grocery store in a section of her house where she sells all kinds of groceries, vegetables, meats and beverages. She started the business when she was still single and needed to help her parents meet family expenses and now it helps her support her own family, too. Her business is well-received because she offers good customer service and high-quality products. Besides, she augments her income with the sale of raspadilla (shaved ice with flavored syrups) during Summer. María Elena wants to enlarge her business by selling soft-drinks. She is asking Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 new soles to buy drinks and shelving to display them. She is a hard-working, enterprising woman. Her greatest wish is to enlarge her busieness so that she can afford her own house. This is her second collaboration with our institution and she has proven to be a responsible and punctual client with respect to her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft-drinks and a display counter.

loans.name: Ihuriro Group, Ntungamo

texts.en: M. Joweria is 40 years old, married, and the mother of four children aged 2 - 17. She also takes care of her parents. Joweria has been selling produce for nine years, which enables her to make  a weekly profit of 120,000 UGX even though the business is affected by low capital and price fluctuations. She is grateful that the loans help her so much in her business and in its market location.  Joweria hopes for further expansion of her business in order to educate her children, build a good house for her family and own a business car to help with the transportation of  goods in the future. She is such a friendly and hard working lady and needs a loan to help with buying more produce for resale.

loans.use: buy more produce for resale

loans.name: Panfila Regina

texts.es: Panfila Regina  labora como docente de primaria en la Escuela Diriangen  desde hace varios años, su familia se siente orgullosa de tener una maestra dentro del nucleo familiar, su esposo  es comerciante de ganado y ademas se dedican a la siembra de yuca y quequisque,  ella se siente agradecida con el credito anterior otorgado por los  financiadores kiva ya que logro satisfatoriamente cumplir con su pequeño proyecto de mejorar su casa,  esta solicitando su 8vo credito y espera seguir contando con el apoyo del fondo kiva para hecharle el piso a la casa  que actualmente no tiene, su sueño es  tener siempre buena salud, que sus hijos estudien y en el futuro tener una casa bonita con mejores condiciones para que sus hijos gozen de mejores condiciones  y tener estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Panfila Regina has been employed as an elementary school teacher at Diriangen School for several years. Her family is very proud to have a teacher in the family. Her husband is a cattle merchant and they also farm yucca and quequisque (a tuber). She is thankful for the previous Kiva loan because it allowed her to finish a small home-improvement project. This is her 8th loan request and she hopes to continue to have Kiva's support, this time to lay a floor in her house, which currently lacks one. Her dream is to always have good health, that her children study, and that she have a pretty house in the future with better conditions so that ther children will enjoy better conditions, and that she have employment security so that she can help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install flooring.

loans.name: Nkongoro Group, Ntungamo

texts.en: N. Lydia is 37 years old, friendly and hard working.  She has been in business, charging phones from the Nkongoro Trading Centre, for 2 years. Lydia is also a farmer and is married with three children aged 10 – 16.  She also takes care of one dependant. Although Lydia has low capital in her phone charging business, she is able to make a weekly profit of 50,000 UGX. She would like to increase her profits by buying an inverter and batteries for customers. She is such a focused lady and her business is booming since very few people have access to electricity. She has been able to educate her children and would like to own more land from her profits and savings.

loans.use: to buy an inverter and batteries for improved services

loans.name: Josephin Epifania

texts.es: Josephin labora en la Alcaldia Municipal de Nueva Guinea, es madre de 3 niños: Lesly que estudia 5to grado de primaria, Johathan de 14 años en 3er año de secundaria y Franklin de 15 años estudiando el 4to asño de secundaria; requiere financiamiento para mejorar su casa y espera contar con el apoyo de kiva para realizar este pequeño proyecto, pues desea ponerle ceramica a la casa y mejorar la cocina.  Ademas tiene un pequeño negocio de Cafetin en la universidad URACAN de Nueva Guinea, de donde obtiene ingresos adicionales para el sustento familiar.  Josephin se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, de buenos valores, honesta y muy querida en su comunidad. Su mayor sueño es tener una casa bonita con las condiciones basicas para que su familia viva comoda.
texts.en:
Josephin works for Nueva Guinea's city hall. She has three children: Lesly, who is a fifth-grader, Johathan, 14, who is in 9th grade, and Franklin, 15, who is in 10th grade. She needs financing to improve her home and she hopes to have Kiva's support with this small project. She wants to install tile flooring in the house and improve her kitchen. Besides, she runs a small cafe in Nueva Granada's URACAN university which produces additional income for her family. Josephin is hard-working, has good values, is honest and very well-liked in her community. Her greatest wish is to have a nice house that has the basic conditions so that her family can live comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To replace the floor and improve the kitchen.

loans.name: Musana Kwebisaho Group, Ntungamo

texts.en: R. Jackson is 56 years old and the leader of his lending group in Ntungamo. He is a hard working and cooperative man, married with six children aged 5 - 28.  He also takes care of his other relatives. For the past 15 years, he has been involved in farming and agriculture, selling farm produce and having a butchery business in Kyangara Trading Centre. He is able to make, on average, a weekly profit of 120,000 UGX because of his good products and services. He hopes to expand his businesses and increase supplies, educate his children and acquire more wealth. Jackson needs a loan to help buy more cows for resale and for meat in his butchery.

loans.use: to buy more cows for meat and for resale

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es: Sandra Maria es una pequeña comerciante del sector de El Almendro, vende cosmeticos, ropa zapatos y encargos que le hacen sus clientes, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien asume los gastos del hogar, ademas poseen un negocio familiar que atiende su marido, es un taller de mecanica en esta misma zona, de donde obtienen ingresos adicionales para el sustento familiar.  Sandra esta solicitando su 1er credito esperando ser beneficiada con el fondo kiva para realizar mejoras a su vivienda, construyendo un dormitorio y de esta manera mejorr la calidad de vida de su familia; es muy reconocida en su comunidad como una mujer trabajadora, de buena conducta, siempre luchando por su trabajo para salir adelante en la educacion de sus hijos, su mayor sueño es que su familia viva en una casa con las condiciones basicas.
texts.en:
Sandra Maria is a small merchant in the El Almendro sector; she sells cosmetics, clothes and shoes, as well as filling orders from her customers. Her husband supports her work efforts and he provides for household expenses. Besides, they own a family business that her husband runs: a machine shop, in the same area, that produces additional family income. Sandra is asking for her first loan, hoping to be supported by Kiva, to do some home improvements. She wants to build a bedroom in order to improve the quality of life for her family. She is very well-known in her community as hard-working, well-behaved, always striving to get ahead and to provide education for her children. Her greatest wish is that her family have the basic needs met in their house to live comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Ancelmo

texts.es: El señor Ancelmo M., habitante de colonia Talolinga desde hace 12 años labora como tecnico Electronico, su familia esta conformada por 4 hijos y su esposa, 3 de sus hijos estudian la educacion secundaria y uno la educacion primaria, su esposa trabaja en la empresa AVON vendiendo productos cosmeticos y le apolla con los gastos del hogar,la mayor necesidad que se le presenta es el sector economico, por que no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para poder comprar los materiales utiles para brindar un buen servicio y poder sastifacer la demanda de los clientes. El espera que AFODENIC, le apolle con este financiamiento para mejorar las condiciones en su taller de manera que su negocio sea mas rentable y mejorar las condiciones de vida  a nivel familiar.
texts.en:
Señor Ancelmo M. lives in the town of Talolinga. For twelve years, he has worked as an electronics technician. His family is made up of four children and his wife. Three of his children study in secondary school and one is in elementary school. His wife sells Avon cosmetics and supports him with their home's expenses. His biggest need is in the economic area because he doesn't have the resources he needs to buy materials to offer a good service and to satisfy his customers' demand. He hopes that Afodenic will support him with this financing so he can improve the conditions of his workshop so that his business will be more profitable and he can improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for his business

loans.name: Rosibel Maria

texts.es: Rosibel Maria tiene la edad 59 años, su actividad económica es la venta de tortillas. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio ella dio inicio a esta actividad por lo que es una mujer muy luchadora a pesar de la edad que ella tiene, la forma de obtener ingresos para mantener a su familia en lo necesario. Su actividad económica es la venta de tortillas y frijoles cocidos, en su vecindario ella ha obtenido la fama necesaria pues la mayoría de personas sus clientes son sus propios vecinos, ella disfruta mucho de su actividad económica ya que es el único medio de vida que tiene. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de maíz, leña y frijoles. Su deseo es mejorar la calidad de sus productos como son las tortillas y proporcionarles las condiciones adecuadas a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosibel Maria, 59, makes and sell tortillas. She has been in this line of work for over 30 years. She began this work because she is hard-working and wants to produce income to support her family. Despite her age, she continues with this work; she sells tortillas and cooked beans. She is famous in her neighborhood; her customers are her neighbors. She enjoys her work very much since this is her only source of income. The funding requested will be used to buy corn, firewood and beans. Her wish is to improve the quality of her tortillas and to provide her home with adequate living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, corn and beans.

loans.name: Walter Jose

texts.es: El joven Walter habitante de la comarca  san Luis, tiene 2 hijos menores,  su esposa se encarga del cuido de la casa y de los niños; Walter desde muy pequeño labora en las actividades pecuarias y agricolas, de donde obtiene ingresos que le permiten el sosten familiar, esta solicitando este financiamiento para mejorar las condiciones de su casa, cambiando las paredes que estan en mal estado, el no cuenta con los recursos economicos necesarios para completar dicha obra, su sueño es que AFODENIC y Kiva le apoyen con el financiamiento para que sus deseos se le hagan realidad, de tener una casa bonita con mejores condiciones garantizando la proteccion de la familia, el se caracteriza por ser responsable, trabajador y  con muchos deseos de superacion.
texts.en:
Young Walter, an inhabitant of the San Luis region, has 2 minor children. His wife takes care of the house and of the children; Walter has recently been working in the areas of hatcheries and agriculture, which give him the income to sustain his family. He is requesting this loan in order to improve his house, changing walls that are in bad condition. He does not have the necessary economic resources to complete the work, so his hope is that AFODENIC and Kiva will help him with the financing. This can turn his dreams into the reality of having a nice house in a condition to protect his family. He characterizes himself as a hard-working and responsible person with a great desire to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair walls

loans.name: Twezimbe Group, Lugazi

texts.en: N. Florence is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is married with six children aged 4 - 18 and she takes care of some orphans. Florence has worked as a tailor in Lweru Trading Centre for four years and is able to make weekly profits amounting to 25,000 UGX. She is grateful to her loans for they enable her to have quality made clothes; however, in the future, she would like to change her main business to animal husbandry so that she could better educate her children. Florence needs a loan to be able to buy more clothing materials and threads to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing materials and threads for her business

loans.name: Osmar Daniel

texts.es: El señor Osmar Daniel, habitante de colonia san Miguel, su familia esta conformada por el y 2 hijos menores;  desde muy pequeño su principal actividad ha sido la ganaderia, el necesita de este financiamiento para retener 4 terneros, de manera que  pueda generar mejores ganancias a la hora de la comercializacion de dichos animales, que le sirva para solventar algunas necesidades en la familia, sus hijos coloboran en las actividades de su pequeña finca, el mayor anhelo de Osmar es aumentar su pequeño hato ganadero con el fin que a futuro sus condiciones economicas le permita vivir una vida mas comoda.
texts.en:
Señor Osmar Daniel lives in the San Miguel neighborhood. His family consists of himself and 2 minor children. Recently his primary work has been with livestock. He needs this financing in order to raise 4 calves, so that he can generate more profits when the animals are sold. This will allow him to take care of family necessities. His children work with him on his small farm. Osmar's greatest wish is to enlarge his little herd of cattle so he will have an economic situation that would allow them a more comfortable life.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising calves

loans.name: Tweweyo Group, Lugazi

texts.en: N. Sarah is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is married, with six children aged 12 - 17, and she takes care of some orphans. For the past 7 years, Sarah has had a retail shop in Nkata Island from which she is able to make a weekly profit of  50,000 UGX. She is grateful to her loans which enable her to have a variety of goods in her shop and, in the future, she hopes to become a wholesaler, which will enable her and her husband to better educate her children. Sarah needs to stock her shop with more goods such as books, geometry sets, pens, pencils and so on since this is the high season for such goods.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es: Don Teodoro es un pequeño ganadero de la comarca Lajerito, jurisdiccion de El Ayote, vive junto a su familia conformada por 4 hijos y su esposa, los 2 hijos menores estudian y en su tiempo libre le brindan su apoyo en el trabajo de la finca, Teodoro tiene su propio inventario de 23 cbzs, esta solicitando su 4to credito para comprr 6 terneros para engordarlos y desarrollarlos para obtener mayores ganancias que le permitan mejorar las condicines de vida de su familia.  El mayor sueño de don Teodoro es poder dar a su familia estabilidad y que sus hijos se preparen para ser personas de bien.
texts.en:
Don Teodoro is a small herder in the Lajerito region, El Ayote jurisdiction. He lives with his wife and 4 children. The 2 younger children are in school, and in their free time they help their father with the farm work. Teodoro has 23 head of cattle. He is requesting his 4th loan in order to buy 6 calves to feed and sell for additional profit that will allow him to improve the living conditions of his family. Don Teodoro's dream is to be able to provide stability to his family, and that his children could prepare themselves to do well.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle to raise

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es:
EL SR. WALTER M. ES UN CLIENTE QUE TIENE COMO OFICIO MECANICO DE VIASION Y SE DEDICA TAMBIEN A LA AGRICULTURA QUE ES LA ACTIVIDA QUE LE BRINDA MAS INGRESOS 
 ES UN CLIENTE MUY ESFORZADO Y EN ESTE CRDITO PRETENDE COMPLETAR CON EL PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR UN TERRENO PARA LA SIEMBRA DE ARROZ 
 EN LA FOTO APARESE EN SU SENTRO DE LABORES JUNTO A UNO DE LOS AVIONES
texts.en:
Walter is a client who is an airplane mechanic by trade and he also works in agriculture, which is the work that brings him the most income.

He is a very hardworking client who wants this loan to buy a plot of land to grow rice.

In the photo he appears in his workplace along with one of the planes.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy land

loans.name: Oasis Group

texts.es:
holLa Señora Noemí García M. es originaria y vecina de una pequeña comunidad llamada Tonalá, Municipio de Ayutla de los Libres dentro del Estado de Guerrero, en México. Para llegar a la comunidad hay una desviación en la carretera antes de llegar a la cabecera municipal se toma un camino de 8 km. De terracería poco transitable en época de lluvias.
Tiene 29 años es una persona casada con 3 hijos de 8 años, 4 años y el tercero de 7 meses.
Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de quesos frescos que ella misma elabora con la leche que compra a los pequeños ganaderos de la localidad.
También tiene una tienda de abarrotes con la cual lleva muy poco tiempo y tiene intenciones de hacer crecer su negocio.
Es una persona casada pero su esposo le aporta muy poco para el gasto ya que se dedica a la agricultura y es mas bien de subsistencia, por eso tiene la necesidad de vender mas productos para incrementar sus ingresos para poder sacar adelante la economía familiar.
Entre sus necesidades están las de comprar una prensadora de quesos para poder diversificar sus productos y poder vender quesos de prensa ya que actualmente solo vende quesos frescos. Y si sigue creciendo en créditos va a poder comprar esa maquinaria con un próximo crédito.
Antes de solicitar crédito con Fundación Realidad estuvo trabajando con una Caja de Ahorros, pero debido al mal servicio se decidió cambiar a Fundación Realidad, para lo cual tuvo que formar un grupo de 12 personas cada quien con sus propias actividades económicas. 
Los nombres de las socias del grupo y sus actividades productivas son los siguientes:

Nombre	Préstamo	     Actividad económica
Areli R. R.	     5,000	Venta de antojitos para comer
Bertoldina C. S.    5,000	Venta de dulces y comida en la escuela
Gumecinda G. M.    5,000	Venta de abarrotes
Elvia R. Matías	     5,000	Venta de frutas y legumbres
Roberto C. C.	     5,000	Venta de dulces
Noemí G. M.	     3,000	Venta de quesos
Lourdes G. C.	     5,000	Elaboración y venta de pan
Irene C. Lozano	     5,000	Venta d eperfumes
Esteban R. M.	     5,000	Venta de abarrotes
Israel R. C.	     5,000	Servicio de transporte de pasajeros
Roberto C. R.    5,000	Venta de productos del campo
Anabel Jijón G.	     5,000	Venta de perfumes
texts.en:
Señora Noemí García M. is from a small community called Tonalá, in the municipality of Ayutla de los Libres, State of Guerrero, Mexico. In order to get to the community, there is a detour off the highway over 8 km. of rough dirt track, barely usable during the rainy season, before arriving at the main town. She is 29, married with 3 children of 8, 4, and 7 months. For the last 3 years she has been selling fresh cheeses that she makes herself with milk that she buys from small dairies in the area. She also has had a grocery shop for a short while, and she would like to enlarge her business. Although she is married, her husband gives her very little towards expenses since he works at subsistence-level agriculture. Therefore she needs to sell more to generate more income to improve the economic situation of her family. Among other necessities is the purchase of a cheese press in order to diversify her products to sell pressed cheeses, since currently she only sells fresh cheese. If she continues to qualify for more credit, she will be able to buy this machine with the next loan. Before requesting a loan through Fundación Realidad, she was working through a savings bank, but because of bad service she decided to change to Fundación Realidad. For this she had to form a group of 12 persons, each with their own economic activity. The names of the members of the group and their business are below: Name, Loan Amount, Business Areli R. R., 5,000, Selling snacks Bertoldina C. S., 5,000, Selling sweets and meals in school Gumecinda G. M., 5,000, Selling groceries Elvia R. Matías, 5,000, Selling fruits and vegetables Roberto C. C., 5,000, Selling candy Noemí G. M., 3,000, Selling cheese Lourdes G. C., 5,000, Baking and selling bread Irene C. Lozano, 5,000, Selling perfumes Esteban R. M., 5,000, Selling groceries Israel R. C., 5,000, Servicing passenger cars Roberto C. R., 5,000, Selling country produce Anabel Jijón G., 5,000, Selling perfumes

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to make cheese

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es casado, tiene 33 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos de 7, 5 y 2 años de edad en casa de sus suegros, ubicada en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se ha dedicado a trabajar como obrero agrícola desde hace 18 años, ha trabajado en empresas agroindustriales y en campos de cultivos de la zona. Actualmente trabaja cuidando y brindando matenimiento a un cultivo de alfalfa (pasto utilizado como forraje para animales). Esta actividad le ha servido para sacar adelante a su familia durante el tiempo que tienen juntos.

Luis desea incursionar en un negocio de venta de lúcuma. El nos comenta que desea comprar esta fruta a los agricultores locales para luego distribuirla a las ciudades de Trujillo y Chiclayo donde es muy solicitada. Actualmente ya tiene pedidos, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para continuar con el negocio. Es por ello que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra de más fruta y en el transporte a los lugares de venta.

Luis es un hombre honesto y trabajador. Su más grande anhelo es poder tener su casa propia y consolidarse como microepresario.
texts.en:
Luis, 33, is married and living with his wife and 3 children ages 7, 5 and 2. They live with his in-laws in the district of Paiján, Ascope Province, La Libertad region, about three hours from the city of Chiclayo. He has been an agricultural worker since the age of 18, both with agroindustrial enterprises and on local fields in the area. Currently he is raising a field of alfalfa, which is used as animal forage. This has enabled him to get his family ahead during the time they have been together. Luis would like to enter into a business selling the local fruit known as eggfruit, buying it from local growers to distribute in the cities of Trujillo and Chiclayo where it is very sought-after. Currently he has orders, but not sufficient capital to continue with the business. This is why he needs to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of $375 to purchase more fruit and transport it to the sales locations. Luis is an honest and hard-working man. His greatest wish is to have his own home and become a solid small businessman.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and commercial sale of eggfruit

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, de 40 años, vive muy feliz en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Santos (45) y sus 2 hijos; Leslie (15) y Jorman (12).
Cada día brinda sus servicios de limpieza en diferentes casas de su localidad; pero desde hace 6 meses encontró un trabajo que le gusta mucho y que puede realizar en sus momentos libres.
Ella elabora todo tipo de accesorios para mujer de diversos modelos, como aretes, collares y pulseras con diferentes tipos de pedrería. Estos materiales los compra, al por mayor, y luego los selecciona con la ayuda de sus hijos, lo que le permite avanzar más rápido. 
En este negocio trabaja en sociedad con una amiga que se encarga de vender la mercadería terminada. Ambas actividades le brindas las ganancias necesarias, que junto con lo ganado por su esposo, les permite solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos. 
Para el futuro, Carmen quiere empezar a vender sus accesorios independientemente, ya que calcula que así obtendría mayores ganancias.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y se compromete a ser responsable en cada cuota, ya que tiene en mente acceder a otros créditos. Carmen tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de más cantidad de material para seguir elaborando sus accesorios y así empezar a independizarse.
texts.en:
Carmen, 40, lives happily in her own home with her husband, Santos (45), and her two children, Leslie (15) and Jorman (12). She works daily as a cleaning lady in various homes in the area but six months ago she found an occupation that she likes a lot and that she can do in her spare time. She makes all kinds of accessories for women like: earrings, necklaces and bracelets. She makes them with various kinds of stones which she buys at wholesale. Her children then help her sort them, which allows her to move ahead faster. She works in partnership with a friend, who's job it is to go out and sell the completed pieces. Both her jobs produce needed profits which, together with her husband's earnings, pay for household expenses and education costs of the children. For the future, Carmen would like to start to sell her accessories independently because she figures her profits would be higher that way. This is her first loan with MFP and she promisses to be punctual with her payments because she is already planning to request future loans. Carmen intends to use the funds to buy supplies to continue to make her accessories and to start to become independent.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies.

loans.name: Carmen Patricia

texts.es:
Carmen C. de 36 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de caña solo cuanta con  luz y agua como servicios básicos, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 10, 13, 20 años de edad. 

Carmen  comenzó hace muchos años atrás con una cámara prestada tomando fotos en fiestas infantiles, poco a poco pudo reunir suficiente dinero para comprarse una cámara. 

En el presente ella trabaja en las escuelas y eventos sociales como fotógrafa, trabaja en conjunto con su hijo mayor, una de las complicaciones que ella tiene es la delincuencia que hay en el sector por donde vive.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una cámara fotográfica profesional para que su hijo pueda trabajar también, en el futuro quiere tener su estudio fotográfico y tener su casa de cemento.
texts.en:
Carmen C., 36, lives in a periurban zone along Guayaquil's beltway. Her house is made of sugar cane stalks and the only utilities it has are electricity and running water. She is a single mother of three children: 10, 13, and 20 years of age. Many years ago, Carmen started taking pictures at children's parties with a borrowed camera. Little by little, she saved enough money to buy her own camera. Currently, she works as a photographer at schools and social events. She works with her eldest son. One of the difficulties is the high crime rate in her area. She will use the funds to buy a professional camera so that her son can work too. In the future, she would like to have a photography studio and a concrete house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a camera.

loans.name: Juan Filiberto

texts.es: Juan Filiberto tiene 63 años de edad, su actividad económica es la venta de granos básicos. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio, para ofrecer a sus clientes el consumo de productos diarios. El negocio inicia por cuenta propia ya que no tenía los ingresos necesarios para proporcionarle a su familia el pan de comida diario. A pesar de lo difícil que es mantener este negocio activo Juan es un hombre que le gusta su actividad ya que él se encarga de ofrecer a sus clientes los mejores servicios. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite y golosinas. Su deseo es seguir adelante con su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Filiberto, 63, sells groceries. He has been in this line of work for over 9 years. He began this business with his own initiative because he did not have sufficient earnings to support his family. Although it is very difficult to maintain this business afloat, Juan is a man that enjoys his work and he offers his customers the very best service. The funding will be used to buy rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, sweets. His wish is to continue with his work so as to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El Banco de Emprendimiento "SAN MIGUEL" se encuentra en su 5º ciclo, todas las socias viven en la zona de San Miguel, tienen puestos de venta de comida internets y tiendas de barrio, Es un grupo responsable y solidario.

Como presidenta esta la señora Magda ella vende carne, tiene su tienda de barrio, y tambien vende almuerzos al medio dia, ella tiene un hijo que ya esta casado, es muy responsable y lider en su grupo, el dinero lo utiliza en compra de abarrotes para su tienda.

Como tesorero esta Andres quien tiene su taller de publicidad en el centro de la ciudad es casado no tiene hijos y conoce muy bien el manejo del dinero , el dinero lo utiliza para mejoramiento de su taller

Como sesretaria esta la señora Angelica la señora es casada tiene 6 hijos, su esposo es cerrajero, es responsable asiste a todas las reuniones y el dinero quese presta es para el negocio del esposo.						
						
Todas las integrantes del banco de emprendimiento son responsables trabajan casi todo el dia para mantener a sus familias ya que muchos tienen hijos que todavia estan en edad escolar y estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianz brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The San Miguel Communal Bank is in its fifth cycle. All of the members live in the San Miguel region. They have stands that sell food, internet access, and neighborhood stores. It is a responsible and united group. Magda is the president. She sells meat. She has a neighborhood store, and she also sells lunch at midday. She has a son who is married. She is very responsible; and she is the leader of the group. She will use the money to buy groceries for her store. Andres is the treasurer. He has an advertising shop in the center of the city. He is married, but he does not have children. He knows how to manage money very well. He will use the money to improve his shop. Angelica is the secretary. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a locksmith. She is responsible, and she attends all of the meetings. The borrowed money is for her husband’s business. All of the members of the communal bank are responsible. They work almost all day to support their families. Many of them have children who are still school-age. They are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and merchandise

loans.name: Farncisco

texts.es:
DON FRANCISCO ES GANADERO DE LA CIUDAD DE CHINANDEGA CON 40 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA EN LA GANADERIA PARA LA PRODUCCION  DE LECHE 
 EN SUS INICIOS EL CLIENTE COMENZO COMO ABRERO DE UNA HACIENDA Y CON LOS ESFUERZOZ EL LOGRO ADQUIRIR GANADO QUE ES LE QUE APARESE ENLA FOTO 
ACTUALMENTE SOLO SE DEDICA A LA PRODUCCION DE LECHE
texts.en:
Don Francisco keeps cattle in the city of Chinandega. He has worked with livestock, producing milk, for 40 years. He started as a laborer on a hacienda and, after great effort, managed to buy his own animals, the cows in the photo. Francisco now lives on what he earns producing and selling milk.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cows for milk business.

loans.name: Kelly Julliana

texts.es:
Kelly es una madre de familia de 29 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y su menor hijo de 6 años de edad en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace seis años se dedica a la comercialización de prendas de vestir, joyas y cubrecamas. Ella nos comenta que empezó este negocio gracias a que pudo ahorrar dinero producto de unos años de trabajo en el país de Chile. Ella compra su mercadería en la ciudad de Trujillo y la distribuye en base a pedidos que le solicitan sus habituales clientes.

El negocio goza de buena acogida y Kelly tiene cada vez más pedidos, pero no se abastece para seguir adelante con él. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más productos para ampliar su negocio.

Kelly es una madre joven, reponsable y emprendedora. Su más grande anhelo es poder reunir junto a su esposo el dinero suficiente para tener su casa propia y brindarle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Kelly, 29, lives with her husband and 6-year-old son in her parents' house. It is located in Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, which is three hours from the city of Chiclayo. For the past 6 years she has sold clothing, jewelry and bedspreads. She tells us that she was able to start this business thanks to some savings she had from working a few years in Chile. She buys her merchandise in the city of Trujillo and she sells it based on prior orders from her regular customers. Her business is well-received and Kelly has more and more orders to fill each time; however, she often lacks funds to buy all the merchandise she needs. She is asking for her first, 1000 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to buy more stock items. Kelly is a young, responsible, enterprising mother. Her greatest wish is to gather, together with her husband, enough money to have their own home and to provide their son with a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Ana  Celina

texts.es: Doña Ana Celina es una mujer muy esforzada y trabajadora, tiene 32 años de edad, procreo tres hijos, los tres estudiantes que junto con su esposo esperan poder apoyarlos para que logren terminar sus estudios. Su negocio es el Alquiler de cuartos que junto con su esposo administran, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de comida en un mercado, su casa ha mejorado grandemente gracias a los financiamiento que Afodenic a dado pues para personas de poco recursos económico es el mejor medio de poder prosperar, muy agradecida con  Dios por que ha logrado tener su casa en mejores condiciones, y mejor seguridad para sus pequeños hijos así como mejor higiene. Con este préstamo seguirá invirtiendo en la compra de materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para hacer un porche,  ya tiene un bajarete, y quiere cerrarlo y repellar las paredes para que se le mire bonita su casa. Sus planes es ponerle piso después ya que es de tierra el cual espera lograrlo a corto plazo con el apoyo de su esposo como el de la institución.
texts.en:
Ana Celina, 32, is a hard-working woman. She has three children, all of whom are in school. Together with her husband, she hopes to help them finish their studies. She and her husband rent out rooms. She used to sell prepared meals in a market. Her house has improved considerably thanks to the financing that Afodenic gives to low-income persons; it is the best way that one can prosper. She is very grateful to God because she has managed to improve her home providing both better security and hygiene for her little ones. This funding will be used to buy building materials like: sand, stone, cement and iron, to build a porch because it's just a mud wall. She wants to enclose it and plaster the walls so that her house will have a pleasant appearance. Later on, she plans to install flooring because it's currently a dirt floor; she hopes to do this in the short run with help from her husband and the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone, sand, cement and iron to build a porch.

loans.name: Alexander Berty

texts.es:
Alexander es un padre de familia de 41 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica al trasporte de carga y pasajeros en su mototaxi desde hace cuatro años. El nos comenta que anteriormente trabajaba como panadero y que, gracias a sus ahorros, pudo adquirir su vehículo con el cual actualmente se gana la vida. Durante el día efectúa labores de transporte y por la tarde reparte pan en los caseríos alejados del distrito, también valiéndose de su vehículo. Con estos ingresos el sostiene la economía de su familia.

El continuo uso otorgado a su unidad móvil ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas mecánicas que requieren de urgente reparación, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 700 nuevos soles para brindarle mantenimiento y reparación a su herramienta de trabajo.

Alexander es un padre trabajador y honrado. Su más grande anhelo es poder adquirir otra moto para que sea trabajada por uno de sus hijos. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Alexander is a 41 year old family man who lives with his wife and two children in the Paijan district, Ascope province, in the region of La Libertad, three hours away from Chiclayo. He has been dedicated to the transport of cargo and passengers in his autorickshaw for the past four years. He tells us that he used to work as a baker and that, thanks to his savings, he managed to acquire his vehicle with which he currently makes his living. During the day he works in transportation while in the afternoons he delivers bread in the faraway homes of the district, also with his vehicle. He supports his family financially with this income. Due to the continued use of his car it has started to suffer from some mechanical issues that require urgent repair. Because of this he has asked for a 700 new soles loan to Edpyme Alternativa, to perform maintenance and repairs for the tool he uses for work. Alexander is a hard-working and honorable father. His biggest wish is to be able to acquire another autorickshaw that can be used by one of his sons. He has previously worked with this institution and has shown to be a punctual and responsible client the moment he gets his bill.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance and Repair of vehicle

loans.name: Maria Dory

texts.es: Doña Maria Dory de 49  años de edad, es casada con el Sr. Reynaldo Arbisu, tiene 5 hijos, 2 mujeres y 3 varones, los cuales le ayudan con el cuido de la finca, habitan en la Comarca LA Pintada del municipio de Muelle de los Bueyes, esta solicitando su 1er credito a AFODENIC con el objetivo de comprar vacas paridas y asi lograr incrementar los ingresos familiares, ya que puede comercializar la leche, vender queso, cuajadas. Cuenta con el apoyo de su marido quien le ayuda a trabajar la finca y a cuidar el ganado.  Espera contar con el apoyo de kiva para lograr establecer esta compra.  Su mayor sueño es lograr incrementar su hato ganadero para obtener mejores ganancias, pues es el patrimonio de su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Maria Dory is 36 years old, and married to Sr. Santana Luna. They live in the Las Pavas region in the municipality of Muelle de los Bueyes. She is requesting her first loan with AFODENIC, with the objective to buy calves to fatten and develop in order to market them at a better price, so that she can increase her family income. She counts on the support of her husband, who helps her work the farm and take care of the livestock. She hopes to count on the support of Kiva in order to set up this purchase. Her biggest dream is to increase her livestock herd in order to earn better profits, as this is the family wealth.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy recently born calves

loans.name: Ángela María

texts.es:
Muy alegremente y con gran entusiasmo, en el municipio de Nagarote la señora Angela C. se dedica a su actividad de elaboración de tortillas las que son preparadas por ella misma y comercializadas a diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.

Ella es casada y con un hijo que mantener y también tiene un nieto que mantener por lo que está solicitando un crédito para la compra de la materia prima como lo es la leña y cuatro quintales de maíz para continuar elaborando las riquísimas tortillas.
texts.en:
Very happily and with great enthusiasm, in the town of Nagarote, Señora Angela C. works making tortillas. She prepares them herself and sells daily, starting in the very early hours of the morning. She is married and has one son to take care of. She also cares for a grandson so she is requesting a loan to buy basic materials like firewood and four 100 pound sacks of corn to continue making her very rich tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and firewood to make tortillas

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
Emiliana, de 47 años, vive al lado de su esposo Juan (52) y con sus 4 jóvenes hijos: Lourdes (30), Juan (27), Miguel (25) y Adrián (6). Todos muy unidos habitan en la tranquilidad de su casa propia.

Desde hace 30 años se dedica a la venta de diversos productos comestibles en la tienda que acondicionó en un ambiente de su casa. Su labor empieza a las 8 de la mañana y termina a las 10 de la noche. Lo que más le agrada de vender es que puede interactuar con sus vecinos, ya que todos acuden regularmente a su tienda debido a la variedad de sus productos que ofrece; desde golosinas hasta verduras, frutas y carne de pollo fresca; además las ganancias son muy buenas porque no tiene competencia cercana.
Como Emiliana es una mujer emprendedora tiene planeado para el futuro mejorar las instalaciones de su tienda y convertirla en un minimercado, para obtener mejores ganancias y ofrecerles lo mejor a sus clientes. 

Ya tiene varios años trabajando con MFP y este es el 10mo préstamo que tiene con la entidad, es por esta razón que se compromete, una vez más, a ser puntual en cada una de sus cuotas. Emiliana tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para su tienda y así seguir progresando en la vida.
texts.en:
Emiliana, 47, lives with her husband, Juan (52) and her four young children: Lourdes (30), Juan (27), Miguel (25) and Adrián (6). They all live together peacefully in their own home. She has sold basic food items for the last 30 years from a grocery store installed in her own home. She starts her work day at 8am and ends at 10pm. What she likes best about her work is interacting with her neighbors since they come to her store regularly to see what she has to offer: everything from sweets to vegetables, fruits, and fresh chicken. Her profits are good because she doesn't have any nearby competition. Because Emiliana is an enterprising woman, she is planning to improve her store's installations and turn it into a minimart in the future, in order to increase her profits and offer the best to her customers. She has collaborated with MFP for many years and this is her 10th loan. She, therefore, pledges, once again, to be very punctual with her payments. Emiliana plans to invest the money in merchandise with which to stock her store and thus continue to progress in life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Eloísa Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Eloisa del Carmen S. se dedica a su actividad de costura en su propia casa de habitación en el municipio de Nagarote trabajando a diario con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su mesa, ella elabora todo tipo de ropa ya sea por encargo o elaboradas por ella misma para la venta.

La razón por la que doña Eloisa está solicitando el crédito es para la compra de tela con el fin de elaborar la ropa y así satisfacer a sus clientes que a diario le visitan en su localidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Eloisa del Carmen S. operates a tailoring business in the house that she owns in Nagarote, working every day to put food on her table. She makes all kinds of clothes, some to order and some of her own design for later sale.

Dona Eloisa is applying for a loan so that she can buy material to make clothes and meet the demand of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material for tailoring business.

loans.name: Edwin Alberto

texts.es:
Edwin es un padre de familia de 35 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 5 y 4 años de edad en casa de sus suegros, ubicada en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 10 años trabaja como transportista de carga y pasajeros en su mototaxi. Este negocio le ha servido para ganarse la vida y ahora se vale de él para solventar la economía de su familia. Usualmente trabaja cubriendo rutas dentro del mismo Paiján, pero eventualmente también brinda servicios en los caseríos de la zona.

El continuo uso otorgado a su vehículo ha hecho que este empiece a sufrir algunas fallas técnicas que requieren de urgente reparación. Por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Edwin es un padre de familia responsable y trabajador. Su mayor anhelo es tener su casa propia. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Edwin is a 35 year old family man. He lives with his wife and their two children, 4 and 5 years old, in his in-law's house, located in the Paiján district, Accope province, La Libertad region, about three hours from the city of Chiclayo. For about 10 years he has worked transporting cargo and passengers on his motorcycle taxi. This business has allowed him to earn a living and now he depends on it to provide for his family's economic needs. He usually works covering routes within Paiján itself, but eventually he also provides service in the neighboring villages. The continuous use of his vehicle has caused it to begin to suffer some technical problems that require urgent repair. For this reason he has seen the necessity of requesting a loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternative. Edwin is a responsible and hard working father and husband. His greatest wish is to have his own house. He has worked previously with our institution and has demonstrated punctuality from the moment he takes on his loan repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenses of repair and maintenance of his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Ernesto José

texts.es:
El señor Ernesto Gonzáles se dedica a su actividad de taller de electricidad automotriz el que desarrolla en el municipio de Nagarote donde a diario atiende a sus fieles clientes que le visitan con el fin de lograr su satisfacción ya que tiene mucha experiencia en el trabajo de electricidad automotriz.

El señor Ernesto es casado y con dos hijos a su cargo a los que debe de mantener y brindarle las condiciones de vida necesarias para su desarrollo. Solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales de trabajo del taller con el fin de sacarle el máximo provecho para obtener los ingresos para el pago del colegio de sus hijos a los que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Sr. Ernesto Gonzales operates a business in Nagarote repairing auto electrical systems, a business that he started from scratch. He works in the shop every day, tending to his loyal customers who rely on the experience he's gained over the years working on electrical systems.

Sr. Ernesto is married and has two children who he is bound to support and provide for. He is applying for a loan to buy supplies for the shop so that, in turn, he can generate the maximum revenue from it, income that will allow him to pay the school fees of the children that he loves so much.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for auto repair shop.

loans.name: Josué Daniel

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote en el deparamento de León, el señor José Daniel D. se dedica con mucho sacrificio a trabajar para brindarle el sustento a sus pequeños hijos que tanto necesitan de su apoyo por ser un padre ejemplar y digno de imitar ya que ha sabido mantener su hogar.

Actualmente sus dos hijos entrarán a la escuela y para ello necesita realizar los pagos escolares y por esto solicita un crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la educación de sus hijos para formarlos y lograr que lleguen a ser profesionales de éxito.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Nagarote in the district of León, Mr. José Daniel D. works, with a lot of self-sacrifice, to provide the basic necessities to his young children who rely completely on his support. He has proven himself to be an exemplary and worthy father who has recognized his responsibility to maintain his household. Currently, his two sons are about to enter a new school. Mr. D. needs to pay for their education, and thus is seeking a loan to invest in the education of his sons and their development. His wish is for them to be able to become successful professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School payments for his children

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es: Don Mauro de 58 años de edad es casado, tiene 5 hijos el mayor de 30 años, otro de 29 años, otro de 27, otro de 23 los cuales trabajan, y la menor Eneyda de 16 años que estudia 3er año de secundaria, su esposa Socorro se encarga del cuido de la casa. Don Mauro trabaja para el Complejo Judicial de Juigalpa como vigilante desde hace 14 años. Esta solicitando su 7mo credito para repellar la casa y reforzar  los pilares que son de madera y se estan dañando, los cuales quiere reparar haciendolos de hierro y brindar mas seguridad a la casa y a su familia.
texts.en:
Don Mauro is 58 years old, is married, and has five children. His oldest is 30 years old, the next is 29, the next is 27, and the next is 23; all of these four work. The youngest is Eneyda who is 16 years old and is in her third year of high school. His wife, Socorro, manages the household. Don Mauro has been working as a guard at the Courthouse of Juigalpa for 14 years. He is seeking his seventh loan to repair his house and to reinforce its wooden pillars that are rotting. He would like to rebuild the pillars out of iron in order to provide more security to the house and to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his house and reinforce its pillars

loans.name: Lester Lenin

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote en León, el señor Lester M. se dedica a su actividad de reparación de bicicletas donde varios clientes llevan dichas bicicletas en mal estado y él las repara eficientemente y logra la satisfacción de cada uno de sus clientes.

Es de importancia destacar que el señor M. es muy trabajador y ha llevado el sustento a su familia. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de materiales de trabajo o herramientas para usarlas en el taller de bicicletas y realizar mas profesionalmente el trabajo en su localidad.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Nagarote in León, Mr. Lester M. owns a bicycle repair business. His many clients bring him their broken bicycles and he efficiently repairs them, earning the satisfaction of every one of his clients. It is important to note that Mr. M. is very hardworking and has been able to provide for his family. The loan he is currently seeking is for the purchase of working materials or tools that he will use in his bicycle workshop to work more professionally out of his store.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of working materials for bicycle repairs

loans.name: Bellky De Los Angeles

texts.es: La joven Bellky de los Ángeles tiene 22 años de edad, soltera y vive junto a sus padres, estudiante de administración de empresa ya casi por culminar mi licenciatura. Trabajo en servicio al cliente desde hace un año, pues todo este tiempo tenía el apoyo de mis padres el cual era bastante dificultoso por que pagaban todos mis gastos ya que se me había hecho difícil encontrar un empleo para ayudarme con mis estudios. Con este préstamo quiere ingresar al curso de titulacion ya que no tiene aun todo el dinero  y es de mucha necesidad ya que espera a futuro con su titulo poder ubicarse en un trabajo donde tenga más oportunidad de ejercer su carrera a si como poder ganar mejor. Y poder seguir estudiando, con el objetivo de mejorar cada día, como apoyar a mis padres económicamente. Contenta por el financiamiento ya que lograra su meta el cual da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible el sueño de muchos Estudiantes de pocos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Ms. Bellky de los Ángeles is 22 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She is studying business administration and has almost finished her bachelor's degree. For a year now, she has been working in customer service, but previously her parents were able to support her financially and pay for all her expenses. It was very hard on them, but she wasn't able to find work that would fully support her studies. With this loan, she will pay for her final course to receive her degree because she currently doesn't have all the money required for the course. She needs to get her degree in order to someday, with the degree, get a job that allows her to actually employ her major and earn more money. She wants to continue studying in order to continue developing her professional skills so that someday she can financially support her parents. She is thankful for the opportunity to receive a loan and she thanks this microfinance institution for fulfilling the dreams of many disadvantaged students.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: In order to pay for the final course of a degree in Business Administration since she does not have the necessary funds

loans.name: Maria Hortensia

texts.es: Maria Hortensia tiene 53 años y su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Hace más de 23 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella tiene 8 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente y ayudan a su Mama, Maria trabajaba fuertemente para poder proporcionarle a todos sus hijos el alimento diario y además sostener las necesidades del hogar, todavía es una mujer muy fuerte pues trabaja diariamente. Con el financiamiento lograra comprar productos como leña, maíz, cal y bolsas plásticas. Su deseo es obtener una casa nueva que sea para sus hijos y les quede de herencia.
texts.en:
Maria Hortensia is 53 years old, and her business is the preparation and sale of tortillas. She has had this business for more than 23 years. She has 8 children, all of whom work independently and help support her. Maria works hard to be able to feed her children every day and take care of household expenses. She is still a strong woman, working every day. With this loan, she will buy products like firewood, corn, the mineral lime, and plastic bags. Her goal is buy a new house that she can live in with her children and leave to them as an inheritance.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Firewood, corn, the mineral lime, and plastic bags for the production of tortillas

loans.name: Elvis Antonio

texts.es:
Elvis es un padre de familia de 27 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de tres y un año de edad en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 10 años trabaja transportando carga y pasajeros en su mototaxi. El nos comenta que empezó alquilando mototaxis y que con sus ahorros pudo adquirir la suya hace cuatro años. Usualmente trabaja dentro de la ciudad aunque a veces también en rutas que unen la ciudad con sus caseríos aledaños.

Por otro lado trabaja eventualmente como obrero. El es consciente de que si quiere ver a su familia progresar tiene que dar todo de si para sacarlos adelante. El continuo uso otorgado a su vehículo ha hecho que presenta algunas fallas que requieran de reparacion urgente, por ello se encuentra solcitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.

Elvis es un padre honrado, empeñoso y trabajador. Su más grande anhelo es poder instalar una bodega en su casa para brindarle a su familia ingresos estables con los cuales puedan mantenerse. Ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nosotros y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Elvis, 27, lives with his wife and their two children. He has a three year old and a one year old. They live in the Paiján distict, Ascope province, in the La Libertad area. It is located three hours from the city of Chiclayo. He has worked transporting cargo and passengers in his “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) for ten years. He tells us that he started by renting mototaxis. Four years ago he was able to get his own with his savings. He usually works within the city, although at times he also works routes that run from the city to the neighboring areas. He sometimes works as a workman. He is aware of the fact that if he wants to see his family progress, he needs to give all of himself to get them ahead. The continual use of his vehicle has caused some defects that need to be repaired urgently. That is why he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 800 PEN. Elvis is an honest and hard-working father. His greatest desire is to be able to set up a convenience store in his house in order to give his family stable income to be able to support themselves. He has worked with us previously, and he has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay expenses of repair and maintenance for his vehicle

loans.name: María Ofelia

texts.es:
El municipio de Nagarote se caracteriza por tener mujeres que preparan el mejor quesillo de Nicaragua que es comprado tanto por personas nacionales como extranjeros. La señora María L. se ha dedicado a la elaboración y venta de quesillos ofrecidos a diario por ella misma con el propósito de obtener los ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia compuesta por sus cuatro hijos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de cebollas, leche, crema, vinagre, bolsas plásticas, tortillas y leña. Espera que su crédito sea otorgado y así continuará llevando el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Nagarote is a city famous for women who prepare the best quesillo (a cottage-cheese like cheese) in Nicaragua. It is bought by both Nicaraguans and foreigners. María L. has made and sold quesillo daily in order to earn income to improve her family's living conditions. She has four children. She requests funds to buy onions, milk, cream, vinegar, plastic bags, tortillas and firewood. She hopes her loan will be granted so that she can continue to support her household.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy onions, milk, cream, vinegar, plastic bags, tortillas and firewood.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: Juan Manuel de 45 años de edad es soltero, tiene 2 hijos: Cristel de 15 años en 4to año de secundaria y Juan Manuel de 10 años en 4to grado de primaria, su compañera de vida Maricela, trabaja y se encarga de la casa. Don Juan trabaja desde hace 5 años para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como colector tributario. Esta solicitando su 2do credito para mejorar su vivienda, construyendo un muro de retencion en la parte trasera de la casa en donde va a comenzar a construir.  El mayor sueño de Juan Manuel es tener una vivienda bonita y comoda para sus hijos ya que es el patrimonio que puede dejarles.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel, 45, is single and has two children: Cristel, 15, who is in 10th grade and Juan Manuel, 10, who is in fourth grade. His life partner, Maricela, works and is in charge of the household. Juan has worked for the Juigalpa's mayor's office as a tax collector for the last 5 years. He is requesting his second loan to do home improvements. He wants to build a retaining wall in the rear of his house where he will begin to build. Juan Manuel's greatest wish is to have an attractive, comfortable home for his children since this is the main asset he can leave them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a retaining wall.

loans.name: Francisco Rene

texts.es: El señor Francisco René tiene 65 años de edad, el tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, por lo que los financiamientos han sido de gran ayuda para su negocio. Su actividad económica es una pulpería, hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar de la manera más humilde, por lo que la realiza con el objetivo de generar ingresos necesarios para su familia. El es una persona muy sociable y que además sus vecinos asisten a su pulpería porque él es un hombre con mucha experiencia. El solicita este financiamiento para la compra de golosinas, pan, leña, azúcar y refrescos naturales. El sueño de Francisco es mantener su actividad activa.
texts.en:
Francisco René, 65, has collaborated with Fundación León 2000 for a long time and the various loans have been of great benefit for his business. He has had a small grocery store for the last 6 years. He has always enjoyed working and does so in a very unassuming way to earn income for his family. He is a very sociable person and his neighbors come to his store because he has a lot of experience. He is asking for this funding to buy stock items like: sweets, bread, firewood, sugar, beverages. Francisco's dream is to stay active.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Christian Alexander

texts.es:
Christian tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica al transporte de carga y pasajeros en su mototaxi desde hace tres años. Anteriormente trabajaba como obrero eventual y con los ahorros de esta actividad pudo adquirir su unidad móvil con la que actualmente se gana la vida. El acostumbra a cubrir rutas dentro de la misma ciudad de Paiján, aunque a veces las realiza entre caseríos. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para solventar sus gastos personales y para apoyar a la economía de su  familia.

El continuo uso brindado a su vehículo ha hecho que este empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Christian es un joven empeñoso y trabajador, sus vecinos y familiares le tienen mucha estima. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario.
texts.en:
Christian, 23, is single and lives with his parents in Paiján distrrict, Ascope province, La Libertad region, which is three hours from Chiclayo. He transports cargo and passengers in his mototaxi (a three-wheeled vehicle used in passenger and cargo transportation).
